fields.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

fields.name: protect_content
fields.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving

fields.name: allow_paid_broadcast
fields.description: Pass True to allow up to 1000 messages per second, ignoring broadcasting limits for a fee of 0.1 Telegram Stars per message. The relevant Stars will be withdrawn from the bot's balance

fields.name: message_effect_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the message effect to be added to the message; for private chats only

fields.name: reply_parameters
fields.description: Description of the message to reply to

fields.name: reply_markup
fields.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard, custom reply keyboard, instructions to remove a reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user

getStickerSet.name: getStickerSet
description: Use this method to get a sticker set. On success, a StickerSet object is returned.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the sticker set

getCustomEmojiStickers.name: getCustomEmojiStickers
description: Use this method to get information about custom emoji stickers by their identifiers. Returns an Array of Sticker objects.

fields.name: custom_emoji_ids
fields.description: A JSON-serialized list of custom emoji identifiers. At most 200 custom emoji identifiers can be specified.

uploadStickerFile.name: uploadStickerFile
description: Use this method to upload a file with a sticker for later use in the createNewStickerSet, addStickerToSet, or replaceStickerInSet methods (the file can be used multiple times). Returns the uploaded File on success.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: User identifier of sticker file owner

fields.name: sticker
fields.description: A file with the sticker in .WEBP, .PNG, .TGS, or .WEBM format. See https://core.telegram.org/stickers for technical requirements. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

fields.name: sticker_format
fields.description: Format of the sticker, must be one of "static", "animated", "video"

createNewStickerSet.name: createNewStickerSet
description: Use this method to create a new sticker set owned by a user. The bot will be able to edit the sticker set thus created. Returns True on success.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: User identifier of created sticker set owner

fields.name: name
fields.description: Short name of sticker set, to be used in t.me/addstickers/ URLs (e.g., animals). Can contain only English letters, digits and underscores. Must begin with a letter, can't contain consecutive underscores and must end in "_by_<bot_username>". <bot_username> is case insensitive. 1-64 characters.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Sticker set title, 1-64 characters

fields.name: stickers
fields.description: A JSON-serialized list of 1-50 initial stickers to be added to the sticker set

fields.name: sticker_type
fields.description: Type of stickers in the set, pass "regular", "mask", or "custom_emoji". By default, a regular sticker set is created.

fields.name: needs_repainting
fields.description: Pass True if stickers in the sticker set must be repainted to the color of text when used in messages, the accent color if used as emoji status, white on chat photos, or another appropriate color based on context; for custom emoji sticker sets only

addStickerToSet.name: addStickerToSet
description: Use this method to add a new sticker to a set created by the bot. Emoji sticker sets can have up to 200 stickers. Other sticker sets can have up to 120 stickers. Returns True on success.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: User identifier of sticker set owner

fields.name: name
fields.description: Sticker set name

fields.name: sticker
fields.description: A JSON-serialized object with information about the added sticker. If exactly the same sticker had already been added to the set, then the set isn't changed.

setStickerPositionInSet.name: setStickerPositionInSet
description: Use this method to move a sticker in a set created by the bot to a specific position. Returns True on success.

fields.name: sticker
fields.description: File identifier of the sticker

fields.name: position
fields.description: New sticker position in the set, zero-based

deleteStickerFromSet.name: deleteStickerFromSet
description: Use this method to delete a sticker from a set created by the bot. Returns True on success.

fields.name: sticker
fields.description: File identifier of the sticker

replaceStickerInSet.name: replaceStickerInSet
description: Use this method to replace an existing sticker in a sticker set with a new one. The method is equivalent to calling deleteStickerFromSet, then addStickerToSet, then setStickerPositionInSet. Returns True on success.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: User identifier of the sticker set owner

fields.name: name
fields.description: Sticker set name

fields.name: old_sticker
fields.description: File identifier of the replaced sticker

fields.name: sticker
fields.description: A JSON-serialized object with information about the added sticker. If exactly the same sticker had already been added to the set, then the set remains unchanged.

setStickerEmojiList.name: setStickerEmojiList
description: Use this method to change the list of emoji assigned to a regular or custom emoji sticker. The sticker must belong to a sticker set created by the bot. Returns True on success.

fields.name: sticker
fields.description: File identifier of the sticker

fields.name: emoji_list
fields.description: A JSON-serialized list of 1-20 emoji associated with the sticker

setStickerKeywords.name: setStickerKeywords
description: Use this method to change search keywords assigned to a regular or custom emoji sticker. The sticker must belong to a sticker set created by the bot. Returns True on success.

fields.name: sticker
fields.description: File identifier of the sticker

fields.name: keywords
fields.description: A JSON-serialized list of 0-20 search keywords for the sticker with total length of up to 64 characters

setStickerMaskPosition.name: setStickerMaskPosition
description: Use this method to change the mask position of a mask sticker. The sticker must belong to a sticker set that was created by the bot. Returns True on success.

fields.name: sticker
fields.description: File identifier of the sticker

fields.name: mask_position
fields.description: A JSON-serialized object with the position where the mask should be placed on faces. Omit the parameter to remove the mask position.

setStickerSetTitle.name: setStickerSetTitle
description: Use this method to set the title of a created sticker set. Returns True on success.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Sticker set name

fields.name: title
fields.description: Sticker set title, 1-64 characters

setStickerSetThumbnail.name: setStickerSetThumbnail
description: Use this method to set the thumbnail of a regular or mask sticker set. The format of the thumbnail file must match the format of the stickers in the set. Returns True on success.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Sticker set name

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: User identifier of the sticker set owner

fields.name: thumbnail
fields.description: A .WEBP or .PNG image with the thumbnail, must be up to 128 kilobytes in size and have a width and height of exactly 100px, or a .TGS animation with a thumbnail up to 32 kilobytes in size (see https://core.telegram.org/stickers#animation-requirements for animated sticker technical requirements), or a .WEBM video with the thumbnail up to 32 kilobytes in size; see https://core.telegram.org/stickers#video-requirements for video sticker technical requirements. Pass a file_id as a String to send a file that already exists on the Telegram servers, pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files. Animated and video sticker set thumbnails can't be uploaded via HTTP URL. If omitted, then the thumbnail is dropped and the first sticker is used as the thumbnail.

fields.name: format
fields.description: Format of the thumbnail, must be one of "static" for a .WEBP or .PNG image, "animated" for a .TGS animation, or "video" for a .WEBM video

setCustomEmojiStickerSetThumbnail.name: setCustomEmojiStickerSetThumbnail
description: Use this method to set the thumbnail of a custom emoji sticker set. Returns True on success.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Sticker set name

fields.name: custom_emoji_id
fields.description: Custom emoji identifier of a sticker from the sticker set; pass an empty string to drop the thumbnail and use the first sticker as the thumbnail.

deleteStickerSet.name: deleteStickerSet
description: Use this method to delete a sticker set that was created by the bot. Returns True on success.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Sticker set name

getAvailableGifts.name: getAvailableGifts
description: Returns the list of gifts that can be sent by the bot to users and channel chats. Requires no parameters. Returns a Gifts object.

sendGift.name: sendGift
description: Sends a gift to the given user or channel chat. The gift can't be converted to Telegram Stars by the receiver. Returns True on success.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Required if chat_id is not specified. Unique identifier of the target user who will receive the gift.

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Required if user_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the chat or username of the channel (in the format @channelusername) that will receive the gift.

fields.name: gift_id
fields.description: Identifier of the gift

fields.name: pay_for_upgrade
fields.description: Pass True to pay for the gift upgrade from the bot's balance, thereby making the upgrade free for the receiver

fields.name: text
fields.description: Text that will be shown along with the gift; 0-128 characters

fields.name: text_parse_mode
fields.description: Mode for parsing entities in the text. See formatting options for more details. Entities other than "bold", "italic", "underline", "strikethrough", "spoiler", and "custom_emoji" are ignored.

fields.name: text_entities
fields.description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the gift text. It can be specified instead of text_parse_mode. Entities other than "bold", "italic", "underline", "strikethrough", "spoiler", and "custom_emoji" are ignored.

verifyUser.name: verifyUser
description: Verifies a user on behalf of the organization which is represented by the bot. Returns True on success.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the target user

fields.name: custom_description
fields.description: Custom description for the verification; 0-70 characters. Must be empty if the organization isn't allowed to provide a custom verification description.

verifyChat.name: verifyChat
description: Verifies a chat on behalf of the organization which is represented by the bot. Returns True on success.

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

fields.name: custom_description
fields.description: Custom description for the verification; 0-70 characters. Must be empty if the organization isn't allowed to provide a custom verification description.

removeUserVerification.name: removeUserVerification
description: Removes verification from a user who is currently verified on behalf of the organization represented by the bot. Returns True on success.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the target user

removeChatVerification.name: removeChatVerification
description: Removes verification from a chat that is currently verified on behalf of the organization represented by the bot. Returns True on success.

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

answerInlineQuery.name: answerInlineQuery
description: Use this method to send answers to an inline query. On success, True is returned.
No more than 50 results per query are allowed.

fields.name: inline_query_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the answered query

fields.name: results
fields.description: A JSON-serialized array of results for the inline query

fields.name: cache_time
fields.description: The maximum amount of time in seconds that the result of the inline query may be cached on the server. Defaults to 300.

fields.name: is_personal
fields.description: Pass True if results may be cached on the server side only for the user that sent the query. By default, results may be returned to any user who sends the same query.

fields.name: next_offset
fields.description: Pass the offset that a client should send in the next query with the same text to receive more results. Pass an empty string if there are no more results or if you don't support pagination. Offset length can't exceed 64 bytes.

fields.name: button
fields.description: A JSON-serialized object describing a button to be shown above inline query results

answerWebAppQuery.name: answerWebAppQuery
description: Use this method to set the result of an interaction with a Web App and send a corresponding message on behalf of the user to the chat from which the query originated. On success, a SentWebAppMessage object is returned.

fields.name: web_app_query_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the query to be answered

fields.name: result
fields.description: A JSON-serialized object describing the message to be sent

savePreparedInlineMessage.name: savePreparedInlineMessage
description: Stores a message that can be sent by a user of a Mini App. Returns a PreparedInlineMessage object.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the target user that can use the prepared message

fields.name: result
fields.description: A JSON-serialized object describing the message to be sent

fields.name: allow_user_chats
fields.description: Pass True if the message can be sent to private chats with users

fields.name: allow_bot_chats
fields.description: Pass True if the message can be sent to private chats with bots

fields.name: allow_group_chats
fields.description: Pass True if the message can be sent to group and supergroup chats

fields.name: allow_channel_chats
fields.description: Pass True if the message can be sent to channel chats

sendInvoice.name: sendInvoice
description: Use this method to send invoices. On success, the sent Message is returned.

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

fields.name: message_thread_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only

fields.name: title
fields.description: Product name, 1-32 characters

fields.name: description
fields.description: Product description, 1-255 characters

fields.name: payload
fields.description: Bot-defined invoice payload, 1-128 bytes. This will not be displayed to the user, use it for your internal processes.

fields.name: provider_token
fields.description: Payment provider token, obtained via @BotFather. Pass an empty string for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code, see more on currencies. Pass "XTR" for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: prices
fields.description: Price breakdown, a JSON-serialized list of components (e.g. product price, tax, discount, delivery cost, delivery tax, bonus, etc.). Must contain exactly one item for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: max_tip_amount
fields.description: The maximum accepted amount for tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a maximum tip of US$ 1.45 pass max_tip_amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies). Defaults to 0. Not supported for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: suggested_tip_amounts
fields.description: A JSON-serialized array of suggested amounts of tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). At most 4 suggested tip amounts can be specified. The suggested tip amounts must be positive, passed in a strictly increased order and must not exceed max_tip_amount.

fields.name: start_parameter
fields.description: Unique deep-linking parameter. If left empty, forwarded copies of the sent message will have a Pay button, allowing multiple users to pay directly from the forwarded message, using the same invoice. If non-empty, forwarded copies of the sent message will have a URL button with a deep link to the bot (instead of a Pay button), with the value used as the start parameter

fields.name: provider_data
fields.description: JSON-serialized data about the invoice, which will be shared with the payment provider. A detailed description of required fields should be provided by the payment provider.

fields.name: photo_url
fields.description: URL of the product photo for the invoice. Can be a photo of the goods or a marketing image for a service. People like it better when they see what they are paying for.

fields.name: photo_size
fields.description: Photo size in bytes

fields.name: photo_width
fields.description: Photo width

fields.name: photo_height
fields.description: Photo height

fields.name: need_name
fields.description: Pass True if you require the user's full name to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: need_phone_number
fields.description: Pass True if you require the user's phone number to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: need_email
fields.description: Pass True if you require the user's email address to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: need_shipping_address
fields.description: Pass True if you require the user's shipping address to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: send_phone_number_to_provider
fields.description: Pass True if the user's phone number should be sent to the provider. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: send_email_to_provider
fields.description: Pass True if the user's email address should be sent to the provider. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: is_flexible
fields.description: Pass True if the final price depends on the shipping method. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: disable_notification
fields.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

fields.name: protect_content
fields.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving

fields.name: allow_paid_broadcast
fields.description: Pass True to allow up to 1000 messages per second, ignoring broadcasting limits for a fee of 0.1 Telegram Stars per message. The relevant Stars will be withdrawn from the bot's balance

fields.name: message_effect_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the message effect to be added to the message; for private chats only

fields.name: reply_parameters
fields.description: Description of the message to reply to

fields.name: reply_markup
fields.description: A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard. If empty, one 'Pay total price' button will be shown. If not empty, the first button must be a Pay button.

createInvoiceLink.name: createInvoiceLink
description: Use this method to create a link for an invoice. Returns the created invoice link as String on success.

fields.name: business_connection_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the business connection on behalf of which the link will be created. For payments in Telegram Stars only.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Product name, 1-32 characters

fields.name: description
fields.description: Product description, 1-255 characters

fields.name: payload
fields.description: Bot-defined invoice payload, 1-128 bytes. This will not be displayed to the user, use it for your internal processes.

fields.name: provider_token
fields.description: Payment provider token, obtained via @BotFather. Pass an empty string for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code, see more on currencies. Pass "XTR" for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: prices
fields.description: Price breakdown, a JSON-serialized list of components (e.g. product price, tax, discount, delivery cost, delivery tax, bonus, etc.). Must contain exactly one item for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: subscription_period
fields.description: The number of seconds the subscription will be active for before the next payment. The currency must be set to "XTR" (Telegram Stars) if the parameter is used. Currently, it must always be 2592000 (30 days) if specified. Any number of subscriptions can be active for a given bot at the same time, including multiple concurrent subscriptions from the same user. Subscription price must no exceed 2500 Telegram Stars.

fields.name: max_tip_amount
fields.description: The maximum accepted amount for tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a maximum tip of US$ 1.45 pass max_tip_amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies). Defaults to 0. Not supported for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: suggested_tip_amounts
fields.description: A JSON-serialized array of suggested amounts of tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). At most 4 suggested tip amounts can be specified. The suggested tip amounts must be positive, passed in a strictly increased order and must not exceed max_tip_amount.

fields.name: provider_data
fields.description: JSON-serialized data about the invoice, which will be shared with the payment provider. A detailed description of required fields should be provided by the payment provider.

fields.name: photo_url
fields.description: URL of the product photo for the invoice. Can be a photo of the goods or a marketing image for a service.

fields.name: photo_size
fields.description: Photo size in bytes

fields.name: photo_width
fields.description: Photo width

fields.name: photo_height
fields.description: Photo height

fields.name: need_name
fields.description: Pass True if you require the user's full name to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: need_phone_number
fields.description: Pass True if you require the user's phone number to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: need_email
fields.description: Pass True if you require the user's email address to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: need_shipping_address
fields.description: Pass True if you require the user's shipping address to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: send_phone_number_to_provider
fields.description: Pass True if the user's phone number should be sent to the provider. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: send_email_to_provider
fields.description: Pass True if the user's email address should be sent to the provider. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

fields.name: is_flexible
fields.description: Pass True if the final price depends on the shipping method. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.

answerShippingQuery.name: answerShippingQuery
description: If you sent an invoice requesting a shipping address and the parameter is_flexible was specified, the Bot API will send an Update with a shipping_query field to the bot. Use this method to reply to shipping queries. On success, True is returned.

fields.name: shipping_query_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the query to be answered

fields.name: ok
fields.description: Pass True if delivery to the specified address is possible and False if there are any problems (for example, if delivery to the specified address is not possible)

fields.name: shipping_options
fields.description: Required if ok is True. A JSON-serialized array of available shipping options.

fields.name: error_message
fields.description: Required if ok is False. Error message in human readable form that explains why it is impossible to complete the order (e.g. "Sorry, delivery to your desired address is unavailable"). Telegram will display this message to the user.

answerPreCheckoutQuery.name: answerPreCheckoutQuery
description: Once the user has confirmed their payment and shipping details, the Bot API sends the final confirmation in the form of an Update with the field pre_checkout_query. Use this method to respond to such pre-checkout queries. On success, True is returned. Note: The Bot API must receive an answer within 10 seconds after the pre-checkout query was sent.

fields.name: pre_checkout_query_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the query to be answered

fields.name: ok
fields.description: Specify True if everything is alright (goods are available, etc.) and the bot is ready to proceed with the order. Use False if there are any problems.

fields.name: error_message
fields.description: Required if ok is False. Error message in human readable form that explains the reason for failure to proceed with the checkout (e.g. "Sorry, somebody just bought the last of our amazing black T-shirts while you were busy filling out your payment details. Please choose a different color or garment!"). Telegram will display this message to the user.

getStarTransactions.name: getStarTransactions
description: Returns the bot's Telegram Star transactions in chronological order. On success, returns a StarTransactions object.

fields.name: offset
fields.description: Number of transactions to skip in the response

fields.name: limit
fields.description: The maximum number of transactions to be retrieved. Values between 1-100 are accepted. Defaults to 100.

refundStarPayment.name: refundStarPayment
description: Refunds a successful payment in Telegram Stars. Returns True on success.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Identifier of the user whose payment will be refunded

fields.name: telegram_payment_charge_id
fields.description: Telegram payment identifier

editUserStarSubscription.name: editUserStarSubscription
description: Allows the bot to cancel or re-enable extension of a subscription paid in Telegram Stars. Returns True on success.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Identifier of the user whose subscription will be edited

fields.name: telegram_payment_charge_id
fields.description: Telegram payment identifier for the subscription

fields.name: is_canceled
fields.description: Pass True to cancel extension of the user subscription; the subscription must be active up to the end of the current subscription period. Pass False to allow the user to re-enable a subscription that was previously canceled by the bot.

setPassportDataErrors.name: setPassportDataErrors
description: Informs a user that some of the Telegram Passport elements they provided contains errors. The user will not be able to re-submit their Passport to you until the errors are fixed (the contents of the field for which you returned the error must change). Returns True on success.

Use this if the data submitted by the user doesn't satisfy the standards your service requires for any reason. For example, if a birthday date seems invalid, a submitted document is blurry, a scan shows evidence of tampering, etc. Supply some details in the error message to make sure the user knows how to correct the issues.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: User identifier

fields.name: errors
fields.description: A JSON-serialized array describing the errors

sendGame.name: sendGame
description: Use this method to send a game. On success, the sent Message is returned.

fields.name: business_connection_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the business connection on behalf of which the message will be sent

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat

fields.name: message_thread_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only

fields.name: game_short_name
fields.description: Short name of the game, serves as the unique identifier for the game. Set up your games via @BotFather.

fields.name: disable_notification
fields.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

fields.name: protect_content
fields.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving

fields.name: allow_paid_broadcast
fields.description: Pass True to allow up to 1000 messages per second, ignoring broadcasting limits for a fee of 0.1 Telegram Stars per message. The relevant Stars will be withdrawn from the bot's balance

fields.name: message_effect_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the message effect to be added to the message; for private chats only

fields.name: reply_parameters
fields.description: Description of the message to reply to

fields.name: reply_markup
fields.description: A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard. If empty, one 'Play game_title' button will be shown. If not empty, the first button must launch the game.

setGameScore.name: setGameScore
description: Use this method to set the score of the specified user in a game message. On success, if the message is not an inline message, the Message is returned, otherwise True is returned. Returns an error, if the new score is not greater than the user's current score in the chat and force is False.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: User identifier

fields.name: score
fields.description: New score, must be non-negative

fields.name: force
fields.description: Pass True if the high score is allowed to decrease. This can be useful when fixing mistakes or banning cheaters

fields.name: disable_edit_message
fields.description: Pass True if the game message should not be automatically edited to include the current scoreboard

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat

fields.name: message_id
fields.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the sent message

fields.name: inline_message_id
fields.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

getGameHighScores.name: getGameHighScores
description: Use this method to get data for high score tables. Will return the score of the specified user and several of their neighbors in a game. Returns an Array of GameHighScore objects.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Target user id

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat

fields.name: message_id
fields.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the sent message

fields.name: inline_message_id
fields.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

Update.name: Update
description: This object represents an incoming update.
At most one of the optional parameters can be present in any given update.

fields.name: update_id
fields.description: The update's unique identifier. Update identifiers start from a certain positive number and increase sequentially. This identifier becomes especially handy if you're using webhooks, since it allows you to ignore repeated updates or to restore the correct update sequence, should they get out of order. If there are no new updates for at least a week, then identifier of the next update will be chosen randomly instead of sequentially.

fields.name: message
fields.description: Optional. New incoming message of any kind - text, photo, sticker, etc.

fields.name: edited_message
fields.description: Optional. New version of a message that is known to the bot and was edited. This update may at times be triggered by changes to message fields that are either unavailable or not actively used by your bot.

fields.name: channel_post
fields.description: Optional. New incoming channel post of any kind - text, photo, sticker, etc.

fields.name: edited_channel_post
fields.description: Optional. New version of a channel post that is known to the bot and was edited. This update may at times be triggered by changes to message fields that are either unavailable or not actively used by your bot.

fields.name: business_connection
fields.description: Optional. The bot was connected to or disconnected from a business account, or a user edited an existing connection with the bot

fields.name: business_message
fields.description: Optional. New message from a connected business account

fields.name: edited_business_message
fields.description: Optional. New version of a message from a connected business account

fields.name: deleted_business_messages
fields.description: Optional. Messages were deleted from a connected business account

fields.name: message_reaction
fields.description: Optional. A reaction to a message was changed by a user. The bot must be an administrator in the chat and must explicitly specify "message_reaction" in the list of allowed_updates to receive these updates. The update isn't received for reactions set by bots.

fields.name: message_reaction_count
fields.description: Optional. Reactions to a message with anonymous reactions were changed. The bot must be an administrator in the chat and must explicitly specify "message_reaction_count" in the list of allowed_updates to receive these updates. The updates are grouped and can be sent with delay up to a few minutes.

fields.name: inline_query
fields.description: Optional. New incoming inline query

fields.name: chosen_inline_result
fields.description: Optional. The result of an inline query that was chosen by a user and sent to their chat partner. Please see our documentation on the feedback collecting for details on how to enable these updates for your bot.

fields.name: callback_query
fields.description: Optional. New incoming callback query

fields.name: shipping_query
fields.description: Optional. New incoming shipping query. Only for invoices with flexible price

fields.name: pre_checkout_query
fields.description: Optional. New incoming pre-checkout query. Contains full information about checkout

fields.name: purchased_paid_media
fields.description: Optional. A user purchased paid media with a non-empty payload sent by the bot in a non-channel chat

fields.name: poll
fields.description: Optional. New poll state. Bots receive only updates about manually stopped polls and polls, which are sent by the bot

fields.name: poll_answer
fields.description: Optional. A user changed their answer in a non-anonymous poll. Bots receive new votes only in polls that were sent by the bot itself.

fields.name: my_chat_member
fields.description: Optional. The bot's chat member status was updated in a chat. For private chats, this update is received only when the bot is blocked or unblocked by the user.

fields.name: chat_member
fields.description: Optional. A chat member's status was updated in a chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat and must explicitly specify "chat_member" in the list of allowed_updates to receive these updates.

fields.name: chat_join_request
fields.description: Optional. A request to join the chat has been sent. The bot must have the can_invite_users administrator right in the chat to receive these updates.

fields.name: chat_boost
fields.description: Optional. A chat boost was added or changed. The bot must be an administrator in the chat to receive these updates.

fields.name: removed_chat_boost
fields.description: Optional. A boost was removed from a chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat to receive these updates.

WebhookInfo.name: WebhookInfo
description: Describes the current status of a webhook.

fields.name: url
fields.description: Webhook URL, may be empty if webhook is not set up

fields.name: has_custom_certificate
fields.description: True, if a custom certificate was provided for webhook certificate checks

fields.name: pending_update_count
fields.description: Number of updates awaiting delivery

fields.name: ip_address
fields.description: Optional. Currently used webhook IP address

fields.name: last_error_date
fields.description: Optional. Unix time for the most recent error that happened when trying to deliver an update via webhook

fields.name: last_error_message
fields.description: Optional. Error message in human-readable format for the most recent error that happened when trying to deliver an update via webhook

fields.name: last_synchronization_error_date
fields.description: Optional. Unix time of the most recent error that happened when trying to synchronize available updates with Telegram datacenters

fields.name: max_connections
fields.description: Optional. The maximum allowed number of simultaneous HTTPS connections to the webhook for update delivery

fields.name: allowed_updates
fields.description: Optional. A list of update types the bot is subscribed to. Defaults to all update types except chat_member

User.name: User
description: This object represents a Telegram user or bot.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this user or bot. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

fields.name: is_bot
fields.description: True, if this user is a bot

fields.name: first_name
fields.description: User's or bot's first name

fields.name: last_name
fields.description: Optional. User's or bot's last name

fields.name: username
fields.description: Optional. User's or bot's username

fields.name: language_code
fields.description: Optional. IETF language tag of the user's language

fields.name: is_premium
fields.description: Optional. True, if this user is a Telegram Premium user

fields.name: added_to_attachment_menu
fields.description: Optional. True, if this user added the bot to the attachment menu

fields.name: can_join_groups
fields.description: Optional. True, if the bot can be invited to groups. Returned only in getMe.

fields.name: can_read_all_group_messages
fields.description: Optional. True, if privacy mode is disabled for the bot. Returned only in getMe.

fields.name: supports_inline_queries
fields.description: Optional. True, if the bot supports inline queries. Returned only in getMe.

fields.name: can_connect_to_business
fields.description: Optional. True, if the bot can be connected to a Telegram Business account to receive its messages. Returned only in getMe.

fields.name: has_main_web_app
fields.description: Optional. True, if the bot has a main Web App. Returned only in getMe.

Chat.name: Chat
description: This object represents a chat.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this chat. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the chat, can be either "private", "group", "supergroup" or "channel"

fields.name: title
fields.description: Optional. Title, for supergroups, channels and group chats

fields.name: username
fields.description: Optional. Username, for private chats, supergroups and channels if available

fields.name: first_name
fields.description: Optional. First name of the other party in a private chat

fields.name: last_name
fields.description: Optional. Last name of the other party in a private chat

fields.name: is_forum
fields.description: Optional. True, if the supergroup chat is a forum (has topics enabled)

ChatFullInfo.name: ChatFullInfo
description: This object contains full information about a chat.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this chat. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the chat, can be either "private", "group", "supergroup" or "channel"

fields.name: title
fields.description: Optional. Title, for supergroups, channels and group chats

fields.name: username
fields.description: Optional. Username, for private chats, supergroups and channels if available

fields.name: first_name
fields.description: Optional. First name of the other party in a private chat

fields.name: last_name
fields.description: Optional. Last name of the other party in a private chat

fields.name: is_forum
fields.description: Optional. True, if the supergroup chat is a forum (has topics enabled)

fields.name: accent_color_id
fields.description: Identifier of the accent color for the chat name and backgrounds of the chat photo, reply header, and link preview. See accent colors for more details.

fields.name: max_reaction_count
fields.description: The maximum number of reactions that can be set on a message in the chat

fields.name: photo
fields.description: Optional. Chat photo

fields.name: active_usernames
fields.description: Optional. If non-empty, the list of all active chat usernames; for private chats, supergroups and channels

fields.name: birthdate
fields.description: Optional. For private chats, the date of birth of the user

fields.name: business_intro
fields.description: Optional. For private chats with business accounts, the intro of the business

fields.name: business_location
fields.description: Optional. For private chats with business accounts, the location of the business

fields.name: business_opening_hours
fields.description: Optional. For private chats with business accounts, the opening hours of the business

fields.name: personal_chat
fields.description: Optional. For private chats, the personal channel of the user

fields.name: available_reactions
fields.description: Optional. List of available reactions allowed in the chat. If omitted, then all emoji reactions are allowed.

fields.name: background_custom_emoji_id
fields.description: Optional. Custom emoji identifier of the emoji chosen by the chat for the reply header and link preview background

fields.name: profile_accent_color_id
fields.description: Optional. Identifier of the accent color for the chat's profile background. See profile accent colors for more details.

fields.name: profile_background_custom_emoji_id
fields.description: Optional. Custom emoji identifier of the emoji chosen by the chat for its profile background

fields.name: emoji_status_custom_emoji_id
fields.description: Optional. Custom emoji identifier of the emoji status of the chat or the other party in a private chat

fields.name: emoji_status_expiration_date
fields.description: Optional. Expiration date of the emoji status of the chat or the other party in a private chat, in Unix time, if any

fields.name: bio
fields.description: Optional. Bio of the other party in a private chat

fields.name: has_private_forwards
fields.description: Optional. True, if privacy settings of the other party in the private chat allows to use tg://user?id=<user_id> links only in chats with the user

fields.name: has_restricted_voice_and_video_messages
fields.description: Optional. True, if the privacy settings of the other party restrict sending voice and video note messages in the private chat

fields.name: join_to_send_messages
fields.description: Optional. True, if users need to join the supergroup before they can send messages

fields.name: join_by_request
fields.description: Optional. True, if all users directly joining the supergroup without using an invite link need to be approved by supergroup administrators

fields.name: description
fields.description: Optional. Description, for groups, supergroups and channel chats

fields.name: invite_link
fields.description: Optional. Primary invite link, for groups, supergroups and channel chats

fields.name: pinned_message
fields.description: Optional. The most recent pinned message (by sending date)

fields.name: permissions
fields.description: Optional. Default chat member permissions, for groups and supergroups

fields.name: can_send_gift
fields.description: Optional. True, if gifts can be sent to the chat

fields.name: can_send_paid_media
fields.description: Optional. True, if paid media messages can be sent or forwarded to the channel chat. The field is available only for channel chats.

fields.name: slow_mode_delay
fields.description: Optional. For supergroups, the minimum allowed delay between consecutive messages sent by each unprivileged user; in seconds

fields.name: unrestrict_boost_count
fields.description: Optional. For supergroups, the minimum number of boosts that a non-administrator user needs to add in order to ignore slow mode and chat permissions

fields.name: message_auto_delete_time
fields.description: Optional. The time after which all messages sent to the chat will be automatically deleted; in seconds

fields.name: has_aggressive_anti_spam_enabled
fields.description: Optional. True, if aggressive anti-spam checks are enabled in the supergroup. The field is only available to chat administrators.

fields.name: has_hidden_members
fields.description: Optional. True, if non-administrators can only get the list of bots and administrators in the chat

fields.name: has_protected_content
fields.description: Optional. True, if messages from the chat can't be forwarded to other chats

fields.name: has_visible_history
fields.description: Optional. True, if new chat members will have access to old messages; available only to chat administrators

fields.name: sticker_set_name
fields.description: Optional. For supergroups, name of the group sticker set

fields.name: can_set_sticker_set
fields.description: Optional. True, if the bot can change the group sticker set

fields.name: custom_emoji_sticker_set_name
fields.description: Optional. For supergroups, the name of the group's custom emoji sticker set. Custom emoji from this set can be used by all users and bots in the group.

fields.name: linked_chat_id
fields.description: Optional. Unique identifier for the linked chat, i.e. the discussion group identifier for a channel and vice versa; for supergroups and channel chats. This identifier may be greater than 32 bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it is smaller than 52 bits, so a signed 64 bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

fields.name: location
fields.description: Optional. For supergroups, the location to which the supergroup is connected

Message.name: Message
description: This object represents a message.

fields.name: message_id
fields.description: Unique message identifier inside this chat. In specific instances (e.g., message containing a video sent to a big chat), the server might automatically schedule a message instead of sending it immediately. In such cases, this field will be 0 and the relevant message will be unusable until it is actually sent

fields.name: message_thread_id
fields.description: Optional. Unique identifier of a message thread to which the message belongs; for supergroups only

fields.name: from
fields.description: Optional. Sender of the message; may be empty for messages sent to channels. For backward compatibility, if the message was sent on behalf of a chat, the field contains a fake sender user in non-channel chats

fields.name: sender_chat
fields.description: Optional. Sender of the message when sent on behalf of a chat. For example, the supergroup itself for messages sent by its anonymous administrators or a linked channel for messages automatically forwarded to the channel's discussion group. For backward compatibility, if the message was sent on behalf of a chat, the field from contains a fake sender user in non-channel chats.

fields.name: sender_boost_count
fields.description: Optional. If the sender of the message boosted the chat, the number of boosts added by the user

fields.name: sender_business_bot
fields.description: Optional. The bot that actually sent the message on behalf of the business account. Available only for outgoing messages sent on behalf of the connected business account.

fields.name: date
fields.description: Date the message was sent in Unix time. It is always a positive number, representing a valid date.

fields.name: business_connection_id
fields.description: Optional. Unique identifier of the business connection from which the message was received. If non-empty, the message belongs to a chat of the corresponding business account that is independent from any potential bot chat which might share the same identifier.

fields.name: chat
fields.description: Chat the message belongs to

fields.name: forward_origin
fields.description: Optional. Information about the original message for forwarded messages

fields.name: is_topic_message
fields.description: Optional. True, if the message is sent to a forum topic

fields.name: is_automatic_forward
fields.description: Optional. True, if the message is a channel post that was automatically forwarded to the connected discussion group

fields.name: reply_to_message
fields.description: Optional. For replies in the same chat and message thread, the original message. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain further reply_to_message fields even if it itself is a reply.

fields.name: external_reply
fields.description: Optional. Information about the message that is being replied to, which may come from another chat or forum topic

fields.name: quote
fields.description: Optional. For replies that quote part of the original message, the quoted part of the message

fields.name: reply_to_story
fields.description: Optional. For replies to a story, the original story

fields.name: via_bot
fields.description: Optional. Bot through which the message was sent

fields.name: edit_date
fields.description: Optional. Date the message was last edited in Unix time

fields.name: has_protected_content
fields.description: Optional. True, if the message can't be forwarded

fields.name: is_from_offline
fields.description: Optional. True, if the message was sent by an implicit action, for example, as an away or a greeting business message, or as a scheduled message

fields.name: media_group_id
fields.description: Optional. The unique identifier of a media message group this message belongs to

fields.name: author_signature
fields.description: Optional. Signature of the post author for messages in channels, or the custom title of an anonymous group administrator

fields.name: text
fields.description: Optional. For text messages, the actual UTF-8 text of the message

fields.name: entities
fields.description: Optional. For text messages, special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the text

fields.name: link_preview_options
fields.description: Optional. Options used for link preview generation for the message, if it is a text message and link preview options were changed

fields.name: effect_id
fields.description: Optional. Unique identifier of the message effect added to the message

fields.name: animation
fields.description: Optional. Message is an animation, information about the animation. For backward compatibility, when this field is set, the document field will also be set

fields.name: audio
fields.description: Optional. Message is an audio file, information about the file

fields.name: document
fields.description: Optional. Message is a general file, information about the file

fields.name: paid_media
fields.description: Optional. Message contains paid media; information about the paid media

fields.name: photo
fields.description: Optional. Message is a photo, available sizes of the photo

fields.name: sticker
fields.description: Optional. Message is a sticker, information about the sticker

fields.name: story
fields.description: Optional. Message is a forwarded story

fields.name: video
fields.description: Optional. Message is a video, information about the video

fields.name: video_note
fields.description: Optional. Message is a video note, information about the video message

fields.name: voice
fields.description: Optional. Message is a voice message, information about the file

fields.name: caption
fields.description: Optional. Caption for the animation, audio, document, paid media, photo, video or voice

fields.name: caption_entities
fields.description: Optional. For messages with a caption, special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the caption

fields.name: show_caption_above_media
fields.description: Optional. True, if the caption must be shown above the message media

fields.name: has_media_spoiler
fields.description: Optional. True, if the message media is covered by a spoiler animation

fields.name: contact
fields.description: Optional. Message is a shared contact, information about the contact

fields.name: dice
fields.description: Optional. Message is a dice with random value

fields.name: game
fields.description: Optional. Message is a game, information about the game. More about games: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#games

fields.name: poll
fields.description: Optional. Message is a native poll, information about the poll

fields.name: venue
fields.description: Optional. Message is a venue, information about the venue. For backward compatibility, when this field is set, the location field will also be set

fields.name: location
fields.description: Optional. Message is a shared location, information about the location

fields.name: new_chat_members
fields.description: Optional. New members that were added to the group or supergroup and information about them (the bot itself may be one of these members)

fields.name: left_chat_member
fields.description: Optional. A member was removed from the group, information about them (this member may be the bot itself)

fields.name: new_chat_title
fields.description: Optional. A chat title was changed to this value

fields.name: new_chat_photo
fields.description: Optional. A chat photo was change to this value

fields.name: delete_chat_photo
fields.description: Optional. Service message: the chat photo was deleted

fields.name: group_chat_created
fields.description: Optional. Service message: the group has been created

fields.name: supergroup_chat_created
fields.description: Optional. Service message: the supergroup has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a supergroup when it is created. It can only be found in reply_to_message if someone replies to a very first message in a directly created supergroup.

fields.name: channel_chat_created
fields.description: Optional. Service message: the channel has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a channel when it is created. It can only be found in reply_to_message if someone replies to a very first message in a channel.

fields.name: message_auto_delete_timer_changed
fields.description: Optional. Service message: auto-delete timer settings changed in the chat

fields.name: migrate_to_chat_id
fields.description: Optional. The group has been migrated to a supergroup with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

fields.name: migrate_from_chat_id
fields.description: Optional. The supergroup has been migrated from a group with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

fields.name: pinned_message
fields.description: Optional. Specified message was pinned. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain further reply_to_message fields even if it itself is a reply.

fields.name: invoice
fields.description: Optional. Message is an invoice for a payment, information about the invoice. More about payments: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#payments

fields.name: successful_payment
fields.description: Optional. Message is a service message about a successful payment, information about the payment. More about payments: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#payments

fields.name: refunded_payment
fields.description: Optional. Message is a service message about a refunded payment, information about the payment. More about payments: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#payments

fields.name: users_shared
fields.description: Optional. Service message: users were shared with the bot

fields.name: chat_shared
fields.description: Optional. Service message: a chat was shared with the bot

fields.name: connected_website
fields.description: Optional. The domain name of the website on which the user has logged in. More about Telegram Login: https://core.telegram.org/widgets/login

fields.name: write_access_allowed
fields.description: Optional. Service message: the user allowed the bot to write messages after adding it to the attachment or side menu, launching a Web App from a link, or accepting an explicit request from a Web App sent by the method requestWriteAccess

fields.name: passport_data
fields.description: Optional. Telegram Passport data

fields.name: proximity_alert_triggered
fields.description: Optional. Service message. A user in the chat triggered another user's proximity alert while sharing Live Location.

fields.name: boost_added
fields.description: Optional. Service message: user boosted the chat

fields.name: chat_background_set
fields.description: Optional. Service message: chat background set

fields.name: forum_topic_created
fields.description: Optional. Service message: forum topic created

fields.name: forum_topic_edited
fields.description: Optional. Service message: forum topic edited

fields.name: forum_topic_closed
fields.description: Optional. Service message: forum topic closed

fields.name: forum_topic_reopened
fields.description: Optional. Service message: forum topic reopened

fields.name: general_forum_topic_hidden
fields.description: Optional. Service message: the 'General' forum topic hidden

fields.name: general_forum_topic_unhidden
fields.description: Optional. Service message: the 'General' forum topic unhidden

fields.name: giveaway_created
fields.description: Optional. Service message: a scheduled giveaway was created

fields.name: giveaway
fields.description: Optional. The message is a scheduled giveaway message

fields.name: giveaway_winners
fields.description: Optional. A giveaway with public winners was completed

fields.name: giveaway_completed
fields.description: Optional. Service message: a giveaway without public winners was completed

fields.name: video_chat_scheduled
fields.description: Optional. Service message: video chat scheduled

fields.name: video_chat_started
fields.description: Optional. Service message: video chat started

fields.name: video_chat_ended
fields.description: Optional. Service message: video chat ended

fields.name: video_chat_participants_invited
fields.description: Optional. Service message: new participants invited to a video chat

fields.name: web_app_data
fields.description: Optional. Service message: data sent by a Web App

fields.name: reply_markup
fields.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message. login_url buttons are represented as ordinary url buttons.

MessageId.name: MessageId
description: This object represents a unique message identifier.

fields.name: message_id
fields.description: Unique message identifier. In specific instances (e.g., message containing a video sent to a big chat), the server might automatically schedule a message instead of sending it immediately. In such cases, this field will be 0 and the relevant message will be unusable until it is actually sent

InaccessibleMessage.name: InaccessibleMessage
description: This object describes a message that was deleted or is otherwise inaccessible to the bot.

fields.name: chat
fields.description: Chat the message belonged to

fields.name: message_id
fields.description: Unique message identifier inside the chat

fields.name: date
fields.description: Always 0. The field can be used to differentiate regular and inaccessible messages.

MaybeInaccessibleMessage.name: MaybeInaccessibleMessage
description: This object describes a message that can be inaccessible to the bot. It can be one of
- Message
- InaccessibleMessage

MessageEntity.name: MessageEntity
description: This object represents one special entity in a text message. For example, hashtags, usernames, URLs, etc.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the entity. Currently, can be "mention" (@username), "hashtag" (#hashtag or #hashtag@chatusername), "cashtag" ($USD or $USD@chatusername), "bot_command" (/start@jobs_bot), "url" (https://telegram.org), "email" (do-not-reply@telegram.org), "phone_number" (+1-212-555-0123), "bold" (bold text), "italic" (italic text), "underline" (underlined text), "strikethrough" (strikethrough text), "spoiler" (spoiler message), "blockquote" (block quotation), "expandable_blockquote" (collapsed-by-default block quotation), "code" (monowidth string), "pre" (monowidth block), "text_link" (for clickable text URLs), "text_mention" (for users without usernames), "custom_emoji" (for inline custom emoji stickers)

fields.name: offset
fields.description: Offset in UTF-16 code units to the start of the entity

fields.name: length
fields.description: Length of the entity in UTF-16 code units

fields.name: url
fields.description: Optional. For "text_link" only, URL that will be opened after user taps on the text

fields.name: user
fields.description: Optional. For "text_mention" only, the mentioned user

fields.name: language
fields.description: Optional. For "pre" only, the programming language of the entity text

fields.name: custom_emoji_id
fields.description: Optional. For "custom_emoji" only, unique identifier of the custom emoji. Use getCustomEmojiStickers to get full information about the sticker

TextQuote.name: TextQuote
description: This object contains information about the quoted part of a message that is replied to by the given message.

fields.name: text
fields.description: Text of the quoted part of a message that is replied to by the given message

fields.name: entities
fields.description: Optional. Special entities that appear in the quote. Currently, only bold, italic, underline, strikethrough, spoiler, and custom_emoji entities are kept in quotes.

fields.name: position
fields.description: Approximate quote position in the original message in UTF-16 code units as specified by the sender

fields.name: is_manual
fields.description: Optional. True, if the quote was chosen manually by the message sender. Otherwise, the quote was added automatically by the server.

ExternalReplyInfo.name: ExternalReplyInfo
description: This object contains information about a message that is being replied to, which may come from another chat or forum topic.

fields.name: origin
fields.description: Origin of the message replied to by the given message

fields.name: chat
fields.description: Optional. Chat the original message belongs to. Available only if the chat is a supergroup or a channel.

fields.name: message_id
fields.description: Optional. Unique message identifier inside the original chat. Available only if the original chat is a supergroup or a channel.

fields.name: link_preview_options
fields.description: Optional. Options used for link preview generation for the original message, if it is a text message

fields.name: animation
fields.description: Optional. Message is an animation, information about the animation

fields.name: audio
fields.description: Optional. Message is an audio file, information about the file

fields.name: document
fields.description: Optional. Message is a general file, information about the file

fields.name: paid_media
fields.description: Optional. Message contains paid media; information about the paid media

fields.name: photo
fields.description: Optional. Message is a photo, available sizes of the photo

fields.name: sticker
fields.description: Optional. Message is a sticker, information about the sticker

fields.name: story
fields.description: Optional. Message is a forwarded story

fields.name: video
fields.description: Optional. Message is a video, information about the video

fields.name: video_note
fields.description: Optional. Message is a video note, information about the video message

fields.name: voice
fields.description: Optional. Message is a voice message, information about the file

fields.name: has_media_spoiler
fields.description: Optional. True, if the message media is covered by a spoiler animation

fields.name: contact
fields.description: Optional. Message is a shared contact, information about the contact

fields.name: dice
fields.description: Optional. Message is a dice with random value

fields.name: game
fields.description: Optional. Message is a game, information about the game. More about games: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#games

fields.name: giveaway
fields.description: Optional. Message is a scheduled giveaway, information about the giveaway

fields.name: giveaway_winners
fields.description: Optional. A giveaway with public winners was completed

fields.name: invoice
fields.description: Optional. Message is an invoice for a payment, information about the invoice. More about payments: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#payments

fields.name: location
fields.description: Optional. Message is a shared location, information about the location

fields.name: poll
fields.description: Optional. Message is a native poll, information about the poll

fields.name: venue
fields.description: Optional. Message is a venue, information about the venue

ReplyParameters.name: ReplyParameters
description: Describes reply parameters for the message that is being sent.

fields.name: message_id
fields.description: Identifier of the message that will be replied to in the current chat, or in the chat chat_id if it is specified

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Optional. If the message to be replied to is from a different chat, unique identifier for the chat or username of the channel (in the format @channelusername). Not supported for messages sent on behalf of a business account.

fields.name: allow_sending_without_reply
fields.description: Optional. Pass True if the message should be sent even if the specified message to be replied to is not found. Always False for replies in another chat or forum topic. Always True for messages sent on behalf of a business account.

fields.name: quote
fields.description: Optional. Quoted part of the message to be replied to; 0-1024 characters after entities parsing. The quote must be an exact substring of the message to be replied to, including bold, italic, underline, strikethrough, spoiler, and custom_emoji entities. The message will fail to send if the quote isn't found in the original message.

fields.name: quote_parse_mode
fields.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the quote. See formatting options for more details.

fields.name: quote_entities
fields.description: Optional. A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the quote. It can be specified instead of quote_parse_mode.

fields.name: quote_position
fields.description: Optional. Position of the quote in the original message in UTF-16 code units

MessageOrigin.name: MessageOrigin
description: This object describes the origin of a message. It can be one of
- MessageOriginUser
- MessageOriginHiddenUser
- MessageOriginChat
- MessageOriginChannel

MessageOriginUser.name: MessageOriginUser
description: The message was originally sent by a known user.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the message origin, always "user"

fields.name: date
fields.description: Date the message was sent originally in Unix time

fields.name: sender_user
fields.description: User that sent the message originally

MessageOriginHiddenUser.name: MessageOriginHiddenUser
description: The message was originally sent by an unknown user.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the message origin, always "hidden_user"

fields.name: date
fields.description: Date the message was sent originally in Unix time

fields.name: sender_user_name
fields.description: Name of the user that sent the message originally

MessageOriginChat.name: MessageOriginChat
description: The message was originally sent on behalf of a chat to a group chat.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the message origin, always "chat"

fields.name: date
fields.description: Date the message was sent originally in Unix time

fields.name: sender_chat
fields.description: Chat that sent the message originally

fields.name: author_signature
fields.description: Optional. For messages originally sent by an anonymous chat administrator, original message author signature

MessageOriginChannel.name: MessageOriginChannel
description: The message was originally sent to a channel chat.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the message origin, always "channel"

fields.name: date
fields.description: Date the message was sent originally in Unix time

fields.name: chat
fields.description: Channel chat to which the message was originally sent

fields.name: message_id
fields.description: Unique message identifier inside the chat

fields.name: author_signature
fields.description: Optional. Signature of the original post author

PhotoSize.name: PhotoSize
description: This object represents one size of a photo or a file / sticker thumbnail.

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

fields.name: file_unique_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

fields.name: width
fields.description: Photo width

fields.name: height
fields.description: Photo height

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: Optional. File size in bytes

Animation.name: Animation
description: This object represents an animation file (GIF or H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video without sound).

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

fields.name: file_unique_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

fields.name: width
fields.description: Video width as defined by the sender

fields.name: height
fields.description: Video height as defined by the sender

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Duration of the video in seconds as defined by the sender

fields.name: thumbnail
fields.description: Optional. Animation thumbnail as defined by the sender

fields.name: file_name
fields.description: Optional. Original animation filename as defined by the sender

fields.name: mime_type
fields.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by the sender

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

Audio.name: Audio
description: This object represents an audio file to be treated as music by the Telegram clients.

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

fields.name: file_unique_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Duration of the audio in seconds as defined by the sender

fields.name: performer
fields.description: Optional. Performer of the audio as defined by the sender or by audio tags

fields.name: title
fields.description: Optional. Title of the audio as defined by the sender or by audio tags

fields.name: file_name
fields.description: Optional. Original filename as defined by the sender

fields.name: mime_type
fields.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by the sender

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

fields.name: thumbnail
fields.description: Optional. Thumbnail of the album cover to which the music file belongs

Document.name: Document
description: This object represents a general file (as opposed to photos, voice messages and audio files).

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

fields.name: file_unique_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

fields.name: thumbnail
fields.description: Optional. Document thumbnail as defined by the sender

fields.name: file_name
fields.description: Optional. Original filename as defined by the sender

fields.name: mime_type
fields.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by the sender

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

Story.name: Story
description: This object represents a story.

fields.name: chat
fields.description: Chat that posted the story

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the story in the chat

Video.name: Video
description: This object represents a video file.

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

fields.name: file_unique_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

fields.name: width
fields.description: Video width as defined by the sender

fields.name: height
fields.description: Video height as defined by the sender

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Duration of the video in seconds as defined by the sender

fields.name: thumbnail
fields.description: Optional. Video thumbnail

fields.name: cover
fields.description: Optional. Available sizes of the cover of the video in the message

fields.name: start_timestamp
fields.description: Optional. Timestamp in seconds from which the video will play in the message

fields.name: file_name
fields.description: Optional. Original filename as defined by the sender

fields.name: mime_type
fields.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by the sender

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

VideoNote.name: VideoNote
description: This object represents a video message (available in Telegram apps as of v.4.0).

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

fields.name: file_unique_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

fields.name: length
fields.description: Video width and height (diameter of the video message) as defined by the sender

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Duration of the video in seconds as defined by the sender

fields.name: thumbnail
fields.description: Optional. Video thumbnail

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: Optional. File size in bytes

Voice.name: Voice
description: This object represents a voice note.

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

fields.name: file_unique_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Duration of the audio in seconds as defined by the sender

fields.name: mime_type
fields.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by the sender

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

PaidMediaInfo.name: PaidMediaInfo
description: Describes the paid media added to a message.

fields.name: star_count
fields.description: The number of Telegram Stars that must be paid to buy access to the media

fields.name: paid_media
fields.description: Information about the paid media

PaidMedia.name: PaidMedia
description: This object describes paid media. Currently, it can be one of
- PaidMediaPreview
- PaidMediaPhoto
- PaidMediaVideo

PaidMediaPreview.name: PaidMediaPreview
description: The paid media isn't available before the payment.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the paid media, always "preview"

fields.name: width
fields.description: Optional. Media width as defined by the sender

fields.name: height
fields.description: Optional. Media height as defined by the sender

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Optional. Duration of the media in seconds as defined by the sender

PaidMediaPhoto.name: PaidMediaPhoto
description: The paid media is a photo.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the paid media, always "photo"

fields.name: photo
fields.description: The photo

PaidMediaVideo.name: PaidMediaVideo
description: The paid media is a video.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the paid media, always "video"

fields.name: video
fields.description: The video
