Contact.name: Contact
description: This object represents a phone contact.

fields.name: phone_number
fields.description: Contact's phone number

fields.name: first_name
fields.description: Contact's first name

fields.name: last_name
fields.description: Optional. Contact's last name

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Optional. Contact's user identifier in Telegram. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

fields.name: vcard
fields.description: Optional. Additional data about the contact in the form of a vCard

Dice.name: Dice
description: This object represents an animated emoji that displays a random value.

fields.name: emoji
fields.description: Emoji on which the dice throw animation is based

fields.name: value
fields.description: Value of the dice, 1-6 for "🎲", "🎯" and "🎳" base emoji, 1-5 for "🏀" and "⚽" base emoji, 1-64 for "🎰" base emoji

PollOption.name: PollOption
description: This object contains information about one answer option in a poll.

fields.name: text
fields.description: Option text, 1-100 characters

fields.name: text_entities
fields.description: Optional. Special entities that appear in the option text. Currently, only custom emoji entities are allowed in poll option texts

fields.name: voter_count
fields.description: Number of users that voted for this option

InputPollOption.name: InputPollOption
description: This object contains information about one answer option in a poll to be sent.

fields.name: text
fields.description: Option text, 1-100 characters

fields.name: text_parse_mode
fields.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the text. See formatting options for more details. Currently, only custom emoji entities are allowed

fields.name: text_entities
fields.description: Optional. A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the poll option text. It can be specified instead of text_parse_mode

PollAnswer.name: PollAnswer
description: This object represents an answer of a user in a non-anonymous poll.

fields.name: poll_id
fields.description: Unique poll identifier

fields.name: voter_chat
fields.description: Optional. The chat that changed the answer to the poll, if the voter is anonymous

fields.name: user
fields.description: Optional. The user that changed the answer to the poll, if the voter isn't anonymous

fields.name: option_ids
fields.description: 0-based identifiers of chosen answer options. May be empty if the vote was retracted.

Poll.name: Poll
description: This object contains information about a poll.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique poll identifier

fields.name: question
fields.description: Poll question, 1-300 characters

fields.name: question_entities
fields.description: Optional. Special entities that appear in the question. Currently, only custom emoji entities are allowed in poll questions

fields.name: options
fields.description: List of poll options

fields.name: total_voter_count
fields.description: Total number of users that voted in the poll

fields.name: is_closed
fields.description: True, if the poll is closed

fields.name: is_anonymous
fields.description: True, if the poll is anonymous

fields.name: type
fields.description: Poll type, currently can be "regular" or "quiz"

fields.name: allows_multiple_answers
fields.description: True, if the poll allows multiple answers

fields.name: correct_option_id
fields.description: Optional. 0-based identifier of the correct answer option. Available only for polls in the quiz mode, which are closed, or was sent (not forwarded) by the bot or to the private chat with the bot.

fields.name: explanation
fields.description: Optional. Text that is shown when a user chooses an incorrect answer or taps on the lamp icon in a quiz-style poll, 0-200 characters

fields.name: explanation_entities
fields.description: Optional. Special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the explanation

fields.name: open_period
fields.description: Optional. Amount of time in seconds the poll will be active after creation

fields.name: close_date
fields.description: Optional. Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the poll will be automatically closed

Location.name: Location
description: This object represents a point on the map.

fields.name: latitude
fields.description: Latitude as defined by the sender

fields.name: longitude
fields.description: Longitude as defined by the sender

fields.name: horizontal_accuracy
fields.description: Optional. The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500

fields.name: live_period
fields.description: Optional. Time relative to the message sending date, during which the location can be updated; in seconds. For active live locations only.

fields.name: heading
fields.description: Optional. The direction in which user is moving, in degrees; 1-360. For active live locations only.

fields.name: proximity_alert_radius
fields.description: Optional. The maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. For sent live locations only.

Venue.name: Venue
description: This object represents a venue.

fields.name: location
fields.description: Venue location. Can't be a live location

fields.name: title
fields.description: Name of the venue

fields.name: address
fields.description: Address of the venue

fields.name: foursquare_id
fields.description: Optional. Foursquare identifier of the venue

fields.name: foursquare_type
fields.description: Optional. Foursquare type of the venue. (For example, "arts_entertainment/default", "arts_entertainment/aquarium" or "food/icecream".)

fields.name: google_place_id
fields.description: Optional. Google Places identifier of the venue

fields.name: google_place_type
fields.description: Optional. Google Places type of the venue. (See supported types.)

WebAppData.name: WebAppData
description: Describes data sent from a Web App to the bot.

fields.name: data
fields.description: The data. Be aware that a bad client can send arbitrary data in this field.

fields.name: button_text
fields.description: Text of the web_app keyboard button from which the Web App was opened. Be aware that a bad client can send arbitrary data in this field.

ProximityAlertTriggered.name: ProximityAlertTriggered
description: This object represents the content of a service message, sent whenever a user in the chat triggers a proximity alert set by another user.

fields.name: traveler
fields.description: User that triggered the alert

fields.name: watcher
fields.description: User that set the alert

fields.name: distance
fields.description: The distance between the users

MessageAutoDeleteTimerChanged.name: MessageAutoDeleteTimerChanged
description: This object represents a service message about a change in auto-delete timer settings.

fields.name: message_auto_delete_time
fields.description: New auto-delete time for messages in the chat; in seconds

ChatBoostAdded.name: ChatBoostAdded
description: This object represents a service message about a user boosting a chat.

fields.name: boost_count
fields.description: Number of boosts added by the user

BackgroundFill.name: BackgroundFill
description: This object describes the way a background is filled based on the selected colors. Currently, it can be one of
- BackgroundFillSolid
- BackgroundFillGradient
- BackgroundFillFreeformGradient

BackgroundFillSolid.name: BackgroundFillSolid
description: The background is filled using the selected color.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the background fill, always "solid"

fields.name: color
fields.description: The color of the background fill in the RGB24 format

BackgroundFillGradient.name: BackgroundFillGradient
description: The background is a gradient fill.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the background fill, always "gradient"

fields.name: top_color
fields.description: Top color of the gradient in the RGB24 format

fields.name: bottom_color
fields.description: Bottom color of the gradient in the RGB24 format

fields.name: rotation_angle
fields.description: Clockwise rotation angle of the background fill in degrees; 0-359

BackgroundFillFreeformGradient.name: BackgroundFillFreeformGradient
description: The background is a freeform gradient that rotates after every message in the chat.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the background fill, always "freeform_gradient"

fields.name: colors
fields.description: A list of the 3 or 4 base colors that are used to generate the freeform gradient in the RGB24 format

BackgroundType.name: BackgroundType
description: This object describes the type of a background. Currently, it can be one of
- BackgroundTypeFill
- BackgroundTypeWallpaper
- BackgroundTypePattern
- BackgroundTypeChatTheme

BackgroundTypeFill.name: BackgroundTypeFill
description: The background is automatically filled based on the selected colors.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the background, always "fill"

fields.name: fill
fields.description: The background fill

fields.name: dark_theme_dimming
fields.description: Dimming of the background in dark themes, as a percentage; 0-100

BackgroundTypeWallpaper.name: BackgroundTypeWallpaper
description: The background is a wallpaper in the JPEG format.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the background, always "wallpaper"

fields.name: document
fields.description: Document with the wallpaper

fields.name: dark_theme_dimming
fields.description: Dimming of the background in dark themes, as a percentage; 0-100

fields.name: is_blurred
fields.description: Optional. True, if the wallpaper is downscaled to fit in a 450x450 square and then box-blurred with radius 12

fields.name: is_moving
fields.description: Optional. True, if the background moves slightly when the device is tilted

BackgroundTypePattern.name: BackgroundTypePattern
description: The background is a .PNG or .TGV (gzipped subset of SVG with MIME type "application/x-tgwallpattern") pattern to be combined with the background fill chosen by the user.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the background, always "pattern"

fields.name: document
fields.description: Document with the pattern

fields.name: fill
fields.description: The background fill that is combined with the pattern

fields.name: intensity
fields.description: Intensity of the pattern when it is shown above the filled background; 0-100

fields.name: is_inverted
fields.description: Optional. True, if the background fill must be applied only to the pattern itself. All other pixels are black in this case. For dark themes only

fields.name: is_moving
fields.description: Optional. True, if the background moves slightly when the device is tilted

BackgroundTypeChatTheme.name: BackgroundTypeChatTheme
description: The background is taken directly from a built-in chat theme.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the background, always "chat_theme"

fields.name: theme_name
fields.description: Name of the chat theme, which is usually an emoji

ChatBackground.name: ChatBackground
description: This object represents a chat background.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the background

ForumTopicCreated.name: ForumTopicCreated
description: This object represents a service message about a new forum topic created in the chat.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the topic

fields.name: icon_color
fields.description: Color of the topic icon in RGB format

fields.name: icon_custom_emoji_id
fields.description: Optional. Unique identifier of the custom emoji shown as the topic icon

ForumTopicClosed.name: ForumTopicClosed
description: This object represents a service message about a forum topic closed in the chat. Currently holds no information.

ForumTopicEdited.name: ForumTopicEdited
description: This object represents a service message about an edited forum topic.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Optional. New name of the topic, if it was edited

fields.name: icon_custom_emoji_id
fields.description: Optional. New identifier of the custom emoji shown as the topic icon, if it was edited; an empty string if the icon was removed

ForumTopicReopened.name: ForumTopicReopened
description: This object represents a service message about a forum topic reopened in the chat. Currently holds no information.

GeneralForumTopicHidden.name: GeneralForumTopicHidden
description: This object represents a service message about General forum topic hidden in the chat. Currently holds no information.

GeneralForumTopicUnhidden.name: GeneralForumTopicUnhidden
description: This object represents a service message about General forum topic unhidden in the chat. Currently holds no information.

SharedUser.name: SharedUser
description: This object contains information about a user that was shared with the bot using a KeyboardButtonRequestUsers button.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Identifier of the shared user. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so 64-bit integers or double-precision float types are safe for storing these identifiers. The bot may not have access to the user and could be unable to use this identifier, unless the user is already known to the bot by some other means.

fields.name: first_name
fields.description: Optional. First name of the user, if the name was requested by the bot

fields.name: last_name
fields.description: Optional. Last name of the user, if the name was requested by the bot

fields.name: username
fields.description: Optional. Username of the user, if the username was requested by the bot

fields.name: photo
fields.description: Optional. Available sizes of the chat photo, if the photo was requested by the bot

UsersShared.name: UsersShared
description: This object contains information about the users whose identifiers were shared with the bot using a KeyboardButtonRequestUsers button.

fields.name: request_id
fields.description: Identifier of the request

fields.name: users
fields.description: Information about users shared with the bot.

ChatShared.name: ChatShared
description: This object contains information about a chat that was shared with the bot using a KeyboardButtonRequestChat button.

fields.name: request_id
fields.description: Identifier of the request

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Identifier of the shared chat. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. The bot may not have access to the chat and could be unable to use this identifier, unless the chat is already known to the bot by some other means.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Optional. Title of the chat, if the title was requested by the bot.

fields.name: username
fields.description: Optional. Username of the chat, if the username was requested by the bot and available.

fields.name: photo
fields.description: Optional. Available sizes of the chat photo, if the photo was requested by the bot

WriteAccessAllowed.name: WriteAccessAllowed
description: This object represents a service message about a user allowing a bot to write messages after adding it to the attachment menu, launching a Web App from a link, or accepting an explicit request from a Web App sent by the method requestWriteAccess.

fields.name: from_request
fields.description: Optional. True, if the access was granted after the user accepted an explicit request from a Web App sent by the method requestWriteAccess

fields.name: web_app_name
fields.description: Optional. Name of the Web App, if the access was granted when the Web App was launched from a link

fields.name: from_attachment_menu
fields.description: Optional. True, if the access was granted when the bot was added to the attachment or side menu

VideoChatScheduled.name: VideoChatScheduled
description: This object represents a service message about a video chat scheduled in the chat.

fields.name: start_date
fields.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the video chat is supposed to be started by a chat administrator

VideoChatStarted.name: VideoChatStarted
description: This object represents a service message about a video chat started in the chat. Currently holds no information.

VideoChatEnded.name: VideoChatEnded
description: This object represents a service message about a video chat ended in the chat.

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Video chat duration in seconds

VideoChatParticipantsInvited.name: VideoChatParticipantsInvited
description: This object represents a service message about new members invited to a video chat.

fields.name: users
fields.description: New members that were invited to the video chat

GiveawayCreated.name: GiveawayCreated
description: This object represents a service message about the creation of a scheduled giveaway.

fields.name: prize_star_count
fields.description: Optional. The number of Telegram Stars to be split between giveaway winners; for Telegram Star giveaways only

Giveaway.name: Giveaway
description: This object represents a message about a scheduled giveaway.

fields.name: chats
fields.description: The list of chats which the user must join to participate in the giveaway

fields.name: winners_selection_date
fields.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when winners of the giveaway will be selected

fields.name: winner_count
fields.description: The number of users which are supposed to be selected as winners of the giveaway

fields.name: only_new_members
fields.description: Optional. True, if only users who join the chats after the giveaway started should be eligible to win

fields.name: has_public_winners
fields.description: Optional. True, if the list of giveaway winners will be visible to everyone

fields.name: prize_description
fields.description: Optional. Description of additional giveaway prize

fields.name: country_codes
fields.description: Optional. A list of two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country codes indicating the countries from which eligible users for the giveaway must come. If empty, then all users can participate in the giveaway. Users with a phone number that was bought on Fragment can always participate in giveaways.

fields.name: prize_star_count
fields.description: Optional. The number of Telegram Stars to be split between giveaway winners; for Telegram Star giveaways only

fields.name: premium_subscription_month_count
fields.description: Optional. The number of months the Telegram Premium subscription won from the giveaway will be active for; for Telegram Premium giveaways only

GiveawayWinners.name: GiveawayWinners
description: This object represents a message about the completion of a giveaway with public winners.

fields.name: chat
fields.description: The chat that created the giveaway

fields.name: giveaway_message_id
fields.description: Identifier of the message with the giveaway in the chat

fields.name: winners_selection_date
fields.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when winners of the giveaway were selected

fields.name: winner_count
fields.description: Total number of winners in the giveaway

fields.name: winners
fields.description: List of up to 100 winners of the giveaway

fields.name: additional_chat_count
fields.description: Optional. The number of other chats the user had to join in order to be eligible for the giveaway

fields.name: prize_star_count
fields.description: Optional. The number of Telegram Stars that were split between giveaway winners; for Telegram Star giveaways only

fields.name: premium_subscription_month_count
fields.description: Optional. The number of months the Telegram Premium subscription won from the giveaway will be active for; for Telegram Premium giveaways only

fields.name: unclaimed_prize_count
fields.description: Optional. Number of undistributed prizes

fields.name: only_new_members
fields.description: Optional. True, if only users who had joined the chats after the giveaway started were eligible to win

fields.name: was_refunded
fields.description: Optional. True, if the giveaway was canceled because the payment for it was refunded

fields.name: prize_description
fields.description: Optional. Description of additional giveaway prize

GiveawayCompleted.name: GiveawayCompleted
description: This object represents a service message about the completion of a giveaway without public winners.

fields.name: winner_count
fields.description: Number of winners in the giveaway

fields.name: unclaimed_prize_count
fields.description: Optional. Number of undistributed prizes

fields.name: giveaway_message
fields.description: Optional. Message with the giveaway that was completed, if it wasn't deleted

fields.name: is_star_giveaway
fields.description: Optional. True, if the giveaway is a Telegram Star giveaway. Otherwise, currently, the giveaway is a Telegram Premium giveaway.

LinkPreviewOptions.name: LinkPreviewOptions
description: Describes the options used for link preview generation.

fields.name: is_disabled
fields.description: Optional. True, if the link preview is disabled

fields.name: url
fields.description: Optional. URL to use for the link preview. If empty, then the first URL found in the message text will be used

fields.name: prefer_small_media
fields.description: Optional. True, if the media in the link preview is supposed to be shrunk; ignored if the URL isn't explicitly specified or media size change isn't supported for the preview

fields.name: prefer_large_media
fields.description: Optional. True, if the media in the link preview is supposed to be enlarged; ignored if the URL isn't explicitly specified or media size change isn't supported for the preview

fields.name: show_above_text
fields.description: Optional. True, if the link preview must be shown above the message text; otherwise, the link preview will be shown below the message text

UserProfilePhotos.name: UserProfilePhotos
description: This object represent a user's profile pictures.

fields.name: total_count
fields.description: Total number of profile pictures the target user has

fields.name: photos
fields.description: Requested profile pictures (in up to 4 sizes each)

File.name: File
description: This object represents a file ready to be downloaded. The file can be downloaded via the link https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path>. It is guaranteed that the link will be valid for at least 1 hour. When the link expires, a new one can be requested by calling getFile.

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

fields.name: file_unique_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

fields.name: file_path
fields.description: Optional. File path. Use https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path> to get the file.

WebAppInfo.name: WebAppInfo
description: Describes a Web App.

fields.name: url
fields.description: An HTTPS URL of a Web App to be opened with additional data as specified in Initializing Web Apps

ReplyKeyboardMarkup.name: ReplyKeyboardMarkup
description: This object represents a custom keyboard with reply options (see Introduction to bots for details and examples). Not supported in channels and for messages sent on behalf of a Telegram Business account.

fields.name: keyboard
fields.description: Array of button rows, each represented by an Array of KeyboardButton objects

fields.name: is_persistent
fields.description: Optional. Requests clients to always show the keyboard when the regular keyboard is hidden. Defaults to false, in which case the custom keyboard can be hidden and opened with a keyboard icon.

fields.name: resize_keyboard
fields.description: Optional. Requests clients to resize the keyboard vertically for optimal fit (e.g., make the keyboard smaller if there are just two rows of buttons). Defaults to false, in which case the custom keyboard is always of the same height as the app's standard keyboard.

fields.name: one_time_keyboard
fields.description: Optional. Requests clients to hide the keyboard as soon as it's been used. The keyboard will still be available, but clients will automatically display the usual letter-keyboard in the chat - the user can press a special button in the input field to see the custom keyboard again. Defaults to false.

fields.name: input_field_placeholder
fields.description: Optional. The placeholder to be shown in the input field when the keyboard is active; 1-64 characters

fields.name: selective
fields.description: Optional. Use this parameter if you want to show the keyboard to specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply to a message in the same chat and forum topic, sender of the original message. Example: A user requests to change the bot's language, bot replies to the request with a keyboard to select the new language. Other users in the group don't see the keyboard.

KeyboardButton.name: KeyboardButton
description: This object represents one button of the reply keyboard. At most one of the optional fields must be used to specify type of the button. For simple text buttons, String can be used instead of this object to specify the button text.
Note: request_users and request_chat options will only work in Telegram versions released after 3 February, 2023. Older clients will display unsupported message.

fields.name: text
fields.description: Text of the button. If none of the optional fields are used, it will be sent as a message when the button is pressed

fields.name: request_users
fields.description: Optional. If specified, pressing the button will open a list of suitable users. Identifiers of selected users will be sent to the bot in a "users_shared" service message. Available in private chats only.

fields.name: request_chat
fields.description: Optional. If specified, pressing the button will open a list of suitable chats. Tapping on a chat will send its identifier to the bot in a "chat_shared" service message. Available in private chats only.

fields.name: request_contact
fields.description: Optional. If True, the user's phone number will be sent as a contact when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.

fields.name: request_location
fields.description: Optional. If True, the user's current location will be sent when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.

fields.name: request_poll
fields.description: Optional. If specified, the user will be asked to create a poll and send it to the bot when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.

fields.name: web_app
fields.description: Optional. If specified, the described Web App will be launched when the button is pressed. The Web App will be able to send a "web_app_data" service message. Available in private chats only.

KeyboardButtonRequestUsers.name: KeyboardButtonRequestUsers
description: This object defines the criteria used to request suitable users. Information about the selected users will be shared with the bot when the corresponding button is pressed. More about requesting users: https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#chat-and-user-selection

fields.name: request_id
fields.description: Signed 32-bit identifier of the request that will be received back in the UsersShared object. Must be unique within the message

fields.name: user_is_bot
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request bots, pass False to request regular users. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

fields.name: user_is_premium
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request premium users, pass False to request non-premium users. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

fields.name: max_quantity
fields.description: Optional. The maximum number of users to be selected; 1-10. Defaults to 1.

fields.name: request_name
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request the users' first and last names

fields.name: request_username
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request the users' usernames

fields.name: request_photo
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request the users' photos

KeyboardButtonRequestChat.name: KeyboardButtonRequestChat
description: This object defines the criteria used to request a suitable chat. Information about the selected chat will be shared with the bot when the corresponding button is pressed. The bot will be granted requested rights in the chat if appropriate. More about requesting chats: https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#chat-and-user-selection.

fields.name: request_id
fields.description: Signed 32-bit identifier of the request, which will be received back in the ChatShared object. Must be unique within the message

fields.name: chat_is_channel
fields.description: Pass True to request a channel chat, pass False to request a group or a supergroup chat.

fields.name: chat_is_forum
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request a forum supergroup, pass False to request a non-forum chat. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

fields.name: chat_has_username
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request a supergroup or a channel with a username, pass False to request a chat without a username. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

fields.name: chat_is_created
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request a chat owned by the user. Otherwise, no additional restrictions are applied.

fields.name: user_administrator_rights
fields.description: Optional. A JSON-serialized object listing the required administrator rights of the user in the chat. The rights must be a superset of bot_administrator_rights. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

fields.name: bot_administrator_rights
fields.description: Optional. A JSON-serialized object listing the required administrator rights of the bot in the chat. The rights must be a subset of user_administrator_rights. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

fields.name: bot_is_member
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request a chat with the bot as a member. Otherwise, no additional restrictions are applied.

fields.name: request_title
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request the chat's title

fields.name: request_username
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request the chat's username

fields.name: request_photo
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request the chat's photo

KeyboardButtonPollType.name: KeyboardButtonPollType
description: This object represents type of a poll, which is allowed to be created and sent when the corresponding button is pressed.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Optional. If quiz is passed, the user will be allowed to create only polls in the quiz mode. If regular is passed, only regular polls will be allowed. Otherwise, the user will be allowed to create a poll of any type.

ReplyKeyboardRemove.name: ReplyKeyboardRemove
description: Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will remove the current custom keyboard and display the default letter-keyboard. By default, custom keyboards are displayed until a new keyboard is sent by a bot. An exception is made for one-time keyboards that are hidden immediately after the user presses a button (see ReplyKeyboardMarkup). Not supported in channels and for messages sent on behalf of a Telegram Business account.

fields.name: remove_keyboard
fields.description: Requests clients to remove the custom keyboard (user will not be able to summon this keyboard; if you want to hide the keyboard from sight but keep it accessible, use one_time_keyboard in ReplyKeyboardMarkup)

fields.name: selective
fields.description: Optional. Use this parameter if you want to remove the keyboard for specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply to a message in the same chat and forum topic, sender of the original message. Example: A user votes in a poll, bot returns confirmation message in reply to the vote and removes the keyboard for that user, while still showing the keyboard with poll options to users who haven't voted yet.

InlineKeyboardMarkup.name: InlineKeyboardMarkup
description: This object represents an inline keyboard that appears right next to the message it belongs to.

fields.name: inline_keyboard
fields.description: Array of button rows, each represented by an Array of InlineKeyboardButton objects

InlineKeyboardButton.name: InlineKeyboardButton
description: This object represents one button of an inline keyboard. Exactly one of the optional fields must be used to specify type of the button.

fields.name: text
fields.description: Label text on the button

fields.name: url
fields.description: Optional. HTTP or tg:// URL to be opened when the button is pressed. Links tg://user?id=<user_id> can be used to mention a user by their identifier without using a username, if this is allowed by their privacy settings.

fields.name: callback_data
fields.description: Optional. Data to be sent in a callback query to the bot when the button is pressed, 1-64 bytes

fields.name: web_app
fields.description: Optional. Description of the Web App that will be launched when the user presses the button. The Web App will be able to send an arbitrary message on behalf of the user using the method answerWebAppQuery. Available only in private chats between a user and the bot. Not supported for messages sent on behalf of a Telegram Business account.

fields.name: login_url
fields.description: Optional. An HTTPS URL used to automatically authorize the user. Can be used as a replacement for the Telegram Login Widget.

fields.name: switch_inline_query
fields.description: Optional. If set, pressing the button will prompt the user to select one of their chats, open that chat and insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the input field. May be empty, in which case just the bot's username will be inserted. Not supported for messages sent on behalf of a Telegram Business account.

fields.name: switch_inline_query_current_chat
fields.description: Optional. If set, pressing the button will insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the current chat's input field. May be empty, in which case only the bot's username will be inserted. This offers a quick way for the user to open your bot in inline mode in the same chat - good for selecting something from multiple options. Not supported in channels and for messages sent on behalf of a Telegram Business account.

fields.name: switch_inline_query_chosen_chat
fields.description: Optional. If set, pressing the button will prompt the user to select one of their chats of the specified type, open that chat and insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the input field. Not supported for messages sent on behalf of a Telegram Business account.

fields.name: copy_text
fields.description: Optional. Description of the button that copies the specified text to the clipboard.

fields.name: callback_game
fields.description: Optional. Description of the game that will be launched when the user presses the button. NOTE: This type of button must always be the first button in the first row.

fields.name: pay
fields.description: Optional. Specify True, to send a Pay button. Substrings "⭐" and "XTR" in the buttons's text will be replaced with a Telegram Star icon. NOTE: This type of button must always be the first button in the first row and can only be used in invoice messages.

LoginUrl.name: LoginUrl
description: This object represents a parameter of the inline keyboard button used to automatically authorize a user. Serves as a great replacement for the Telegram Login Widget when the user is coming from Telegram. All the user needs to do is tap/click a button and confirm that they want to log in:
Telegram apps support these buttons as of version 5.7.

fields.name: url
fields.description: An HTTPS URL to be opened with user authorization data added to the query string when the button is pressed. If the user refuses to provide authorization data, the original URL without information about the user will be opened. The data added is the same as described in Receiving authorization data. NOTE: You must always check the hash of the received data to verify the authentication and the integrity of the data as described in Checking authorization.

fields.name: forward_text
fields.description: Optional. New text of the button in forwarded messages.

fields.name: bot_username
fields.description: Optional. Username of a bot, which will be used for user authorization. See Setting up a bot for more details. If not specified, the current bot's username will be assumed. The url's domain must be the same as the domain linked with the bot. See Linking your domain to the bot for more details.

fields.name: request_write_access
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request the permission for your bot to send messages to the user.

SwitchInlineQueryChosenChat.name: SwitchInlineQueryChosenChat
description: This object represents an inline button that switches the current user to inline mode in a chosen chat, with an optional default inline query.

fields.name: query
fields.description: Optional. The default inline query to be inserted in the input field. If left empty, only the bot's username will be inserted

fields.name: allow_user_chats
fields.description: Optional. True, if private chats with users can be chosen

fields.name: allow_bot_chats
fields.description: Optional. True, if private chats with bots can be chosen

fields.name: allow_group_chats
fields.description: Optional. True, if group and supergroup chats can be chosen

fields.name: allow_channel_chats
fields.description: Optional. True, if channel chats can be chosen

CopyTextButton.name: CopyTextButton
description: This object represents an inline keyboard button that copies specified text to the clipboard.

fields.name: text
fields.description: The text to be copied to the clipboard; 1-256 characters

CallbackQuery.name: CallbackQuery
description: This object represents an incoming callback query from a callback button in an inline keyboard. If the button that originated the query was attached to a message sent by the bot, the field message will be present. If the button was attached to a message sent via the bot (in inline mode), the field inline_message_id will be present. Exactly one of the fields data or game_short_name will be present.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this query

fields.name: from
fields.description: Sender

fields.name: message
fields.description: Optional. Message sent by the bot with the callback button that originated the query

fields.name: inline_message_id
fields.description: Optional. Identifier of the message sent via the bot in inline mode, that originated the query.

fields.name: chat_instance
fields.description: Global identifier, uniquely corresponding to the chat to which the message with the callback button was sent. Useful for high scores in games.

fields.name: data
fields.description: Optional. Data associated with the callback button. Be aware that the message originated the query can contain no callback buttons with this data.

fields.name: game_short_name
fields.description: Optional. Short name of a Game to be returned, serves as the unique identifier for the game

ForceReply.name: ForceReply
description: Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will display a reply interface to the user (act as if the user has selected the bot's message and tapped 'Reply'). This can be extremely useful if you want to create user-friendly step-by-step interfaces without having to sacrifice privacy mode. Not supported in channels and for messages sent on behalf of a Telegram Business account.

fields.name: force_reply
fields.description: Shows reply interface to the user, as if they manually selected the bot's message and tapped 'Reply'

fields.name: input_field_placeholder
fields.description: Optional. The placeholder to be shown in the input field when the reply is active; 1-64 characters

fields.name: selective
fields.description: Optional. Use this parameter if you want to force reply from specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply to a message in the same chat and forum topic, sender of the original message.

ChatPhoto.name: ChatPhoto
description: This object represents a chat photo.

fields.name: small_file_id
fields.description: File identifier of small (160x160) chat photo. This file_id can be used only for photo download and only for as long as the photo is not changed.

fields.name: small_file_unique_id
fields.description: Unique file identifier of small (160x160) chat photo, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

fields.name: big_file_id
fields.description: File identifier of big (640x640) chat photo. This file_id can be used only for photo download and only for as long as the photo is not changed.

fields.name: big_file_unique_id
fields.description: Unique file identifier of big (640x640) chat photo, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

ChatInviteLink.name: ChatInviteLink
description: Represents an invite link for a chat.

fields.name: invite_link
fields.description: The invite link. If the link was created by another chat administrator, then the second part of the link will be replaced with "...".

fields.name: creator
fields.description: Creator of the link

fields.name: creates_join_request
fields.description: True, if users joining the chat via the link need to be approved by chat administrators

fields.name: is_primary
fields.description: True, if the link is primary

fields.name: is_revoked
fields.description: True, if the link is revoked

fields.name: name
fields.description: Optional. Invite link name

fields.name: expire_date
fields.description: Optional. Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the link will expire or has been expired

fields.name: member_limit
fields.description: Optional. The maximum number of users that can be members of the chat simultaneously after joining the chat via this invite link; 1-99999

fields.name: pending_join_request_count
fields.description: Optional. Number of pending join requests created using this link

fields.name: subscription_period
fields.description: Optional. The number of seconds the subscription will be active for before the next payment

fields.name: subscription_price
fields.description: Optional. The amount of Telegram Stars a user must pay initially and after each subsequent subscription period to be a member of the chat using the link

ChatAdministratorRights.name: ChatAdministratorRights
description: Represents the rights of an administrator in a chat.

fields.name: is_anonymous
fields.description: True, if the user's presence in the chat is hidden

fields.name: can_manage_chat
fields.description: True, if the administrator can access the chat event log, get boost list, see hidden supergroup and channel members, report spam messages and ignore slow mode. Implied by any other administrator privilege.

fields.name: can_delete_messages
fields.description: True, if the administrator can delete messages of other users

fields.name: can_manage_video_chats
fields.description: True, if the administrator can manage video chats

fields.name: can_restrict_members
fields.description: True, if the administrator can restrict, ban or unban chat members, or access supergroup statistics

fields.name: can_promote_members
fields.description: True, if the administrator can add new administrators with a subset of their own privileges or demote administrators that they have promoted, directly or indirectly (promoted by administrators that were appointed by the user)

fields.name: can_change_info
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings

fields.name: can_invite_users
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

fields.name: can_post_stories
fields.description: True, if the administrator can post stories to the chat

fields.name: can_edit_stories
fields.description: True, if the administrator can edit stories posted by other users, post stories to the chat page, pin chat stories, and access the chat's story archive

fields.name: can_delete_stories
fields.description: True, if the administrator can delete stories posted by other users

fields.name: can_post_messages
fields.description: Optional. True, if the administrator can post messages in the channel, or access channel statistics; for channels only

fields.name: can_edit_messages
fields.description: Optional. True, if the administrator can edit messages of other users and can pin messages; for channels only

fields.name: can_pin_messages
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to pin messages; for groups and supergroups only

fields.name: can_manage_topics
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to create, rename, close, and reopen forum topics; for supergroups only

ChatMemberUpdated.name: ChatMemberUpdated
description: This object represents changes in the status of a chat member.

fields.name: chat
fields.description: Chat the user belongs to

fields.name: from
fields.description: Performer of the action, which resulted in the change

fields.name: date
fields.description: Date the change was done in Unix time

fields.name: old_chat_member
fields.description: Previous information about the chat member

fields.name: new_chat_member
fields.description: New information about the chat member

fields.name: invite_link
fields.description: Optional. Chat invite link, which was used by the user to join the chat; for joining by invite link events only.

fields.name: via_join_request
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user joined the chat after sending a direct join request without using an invite link and being approved by an administrator

fields.name: via_chat_folder_invite_link
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user joined the chat via a chat folder invite link

ChatMember.name: ChatMember
description: This object contains information about one member of a chat. Currently, the following 6 types of chat members are supported:
- ChatMemberOwner
- ChatMemberAdministrator
- ChatMemberMember
- ChatMemberRestricted
- ChatMemberLeft
- ChatMemberBanned

ChatMemberOwner.name: ChatMemberOwner
description: Represents a chat member that owns the chat and has all administrator privileges.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The member's status in the chat, always "creator"

fields.name: user
fields.description: Information about the user

fields.name: is_anonymous
fields.description: True, if the user's presence in the chat is hidden

fields.name: custom_title
fields.description: Optional. Custom title for this user

ChatMemberAdministrator.name: ChatMemberAdministrator
description: Represents a chat member that has some additional privileges.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The member's status in the chat, always "administrator"

fields.name: user
fields.description: Information about the user

fields.name: can_be_edited
fields.description: True, if the bot is allowed to edit administrator privileges of that user

fields.name: is_anonymous
fields.description: True, if the user's presence in the chat is hidden

fields.name: can_manage_chat
fields.description: True, if the administrator can access the chat event log, get boost list, see hidden supergroup and channel members, report spam messages and ignore slow mode. Implied by any other administrator privilege.

fields.name: can_delete_messages
fields.description: True, if the administrator can delete messages of other users

fields.name: can_manage_video_chats
fields.description: True, if the administrator can manage video chats

fields.name: can_restrict_members
fields.description: True, if the administrator can restrict, ban or unban chat members, or access supergroup statistics

fields.name: can_promote_members
fields.description: True, if the administrator can add new administrators with a subset of their own privileges or demote administrators that they have promoted, directly or indirectly (promoted by administrators that were appointed by the user)

fields.name: can_change_info
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings

fields.name: can_invite_users
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

fields.name: can_post_stories
fields.description: True, if the administrator can post stories to the chat

fields.name: can_edit_stories
fields.description: True, if the administrator can edit stories posted by other users, post stories to the chat page, pin chat stories, and access the chat's story archive

fields.name: can_delete_stories
fields.description: True, if the administrator can delete stories posted by other users

fields.name: can_post_messages
fields.description: Optional. True, if the administrator can post messages in the channel, or access channel statistics; for channels only

fields.name: can_edit_messages
fields.description: Optional. True, if the administrator can edit messages of other users and can pin messages; for channels only

fields.name: can_pin_messages
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to pin messages; for groups and supergroups only

fields.name: can_manage_topics
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to create, rename, close, and reopen forum topics; for supergroups only

fields.name: custom_title
fields.description: Optional. Custom title for this user

ChatMemberMember.name: ChatMemberMember
description: Represents a chat member that has no additional privileges or restrictions.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The member's status in the chat, always "member"

fields.name: user
fields.description: Information about the user

fields.name: until_date
fields.description: Optional. Date when the user's subscription will expire; Unix time

ChatMemberRestricted.name: ChatMemberRestricted
description: Represents a chat member that is under certain restrictions in the chat. Supergroups only.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The member's status in the chat, always "restricted"

fields.name: user
fields.description: Information about the user

fields.name: is_member
fields.description: True, if the user is a member of the chat at the moment of the request

fields.name: can_send_messages
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to send text messages, contacts, giveaways, giveaway winners, invoices, locations and venues

fields.name: can_send_audios
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to send audios

fields.name: can_send_documents
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to send documents

fields.name: can_send_photos
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to send photos

fields.name: can_send_videos
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to send videos

fields.name: can_send_video_notes
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to send video notes

fields.name: can_send_voice_notes
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to send voice notes

fields.name: can_send_polls
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to send polls

fields.name: can_send_other_messages
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to send animations, games, stickers and use inline bots

fields.name: can_add_web_page_previews
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to add web page previews to their messages

fields.name: can_change_info
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings

fields.name: can_invite_users
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

fields.name: can_pin_messages
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to pin messages

fields.name: can_manage_topics
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to create forum topics

fields.name: until_date
fields.description: Date when restrictions will be lifted for this user; Unix time. If 0, then the user is restricted forever

ChatMemberLeft.name: ChatMemberLeft
description: Represents a chat member that isn't currently a member of the chat, but may join it themselves.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The member's status in the chat, always "left"

fields.name: user
fields.description: Information about the user

ChatMemberBanned.name: ChatMemberBanned
description: Represents a chat member that was banned in the chat and can't return to the chat or view chat messages.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The member's status in the chat, always "kicked"

fields.name: user
fields.description: Information about the user

fields.name: until_date
fields.description: Date when restrictions will be lifted for this user; Unix time. If 0, then the user is banned forever

ChatJoinRequest.name: ChatJoinRequest
description: Represents a join request sent to a chat.

fields.name: chat
fields.description: Chat to which the request was sent

fields.name: from
fields.description: User that sent the join request

fields.name: user_chat_id
fields.description: Identifier of a private chat with the user who sent the join request. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. The bot can use this identifier for 5 minutes to send messages until the join request is processed, assuming no other administrator contacted the user.

fields.name: date
fields.description: Date the request was sent in Unix time

fields.name: bio
fields.description: Optional. Bio of the user.

fields.name: invite_link
fields.description: Optional. Chat invite link that was used by the user to send the join request

ChatPermissions.name: ChatPermissions
description: Describes actions that a non-administrator user is allowed to take in a chat.

fields.name: can_send_messages
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send text messages, contacts, giveaways, giveaway winners, invoices, locations and venues

fields.name: can_send_audios
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send audios

fields.name: can_send_documents
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send documents

fields.name: can_send_photos
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send photos

fields.name: can_send_videos
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send videos

fields.name: can_send_video_notes
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send video notes

fields.name: can_send_voice_notes
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send voice notes

fields.name: can_send_polls
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send polls

fields.name: can_send_other_messages
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send animations, games, stickers and use inline bots

fields.name: can_add_web_page_previews
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to add web page previews to their messages

fields.name: can_change_info
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings. Ignored in public supergroups

fields.name: can_invite_users
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

fields.name: can_pin_messages
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to pin messages. Ignored in public supergroups

fields.name: can_manage_topics
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to create forum topics. If omitted defaults to the value of can_pin_messages

Birthdate.name: Birthdate
description: Describes the birthdate of a user.

fields.name: day
fields.description: Day of the user's birth; 1-31

fields.name: month
fields.description: Month of the user's birth; 1-12

fields.name: year
fields.description: Optional. Year of the user's birth

BusinessIntro.name: BusinessIntro
description: Contains information about the start page settings of a Telegram Business account.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Optional. Title text of the business intro

fields.name: message
fields.description: Optional. Message text of the business intro

fields.name: sticker
fields.description: Optional. Sticker of the business intro

BusinessLocation.name: BusinessLocation
description: Contains information about the location of a Telegram Business account.

fields.name: address
fields.description: Address of the business

fields.name: location
fields.description: Optional. Location of the business

BusinessOpeningHoursInterval.name: BusinessOpeningHoursInterval
description: Describes an interval of time during which a business is open.

fields.name: opening_minute
fields.description: The minute's sequence number in a week, starting on Monday, marking the start of the time interval during which the business is open; 0 - 7 * 24 * 60

fields.name: closing_minute
fields.description: The minute's sequence number in a week, starting on Monday, marking the end of the time interval during which the business is open; 0 - 8 * 24 * 60

BusinessOpeningHours.name: BusinessOpeningHours
description: Describes the opening hours of a business.

fields.name: time_zone_name
fields.description: Unique name of the time zone for which the opening hours are defined

fields.name: opening_hours
fields.description: List of time intervals describing business opening hours

ChatLocation.name: ChatLocation
description: Represents a location to which a chat is connected.

fields.name: location
fields.description: The location to which the supergroup is connected. Can't be a live location.

fields.name: address
fields.description: Location address; 1-64 characters, as defined by the chat owner

ReactionType.name: ReactionType
description: This object describes the type of a reaction. Currently, it can be one of
- ReactionTypeEmoji
- ReactionTypeCustomEmoji
- ReactionTypePaid

ReactionTypeEmoji.name: ReactionTypeEmoji
description: The reaction is based on an emoji.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the reaction, always "emoji"

ReactionTypeCustomEmoji.name: ReactionTypeCustomEmoji
description: The reaction is based on a custom emoji.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the reaction, always "custom_emoji"

fields.name: custom_emoji_id
fields.description: Custom emoji identifier

ReactionTypePaid.name: ReactionTypePaid
description: The reaction is paid.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the reaction, always "paid"

ReactionCount.name: ReactionCount
description: Represents a reaction added to a message along with the number of times it was added.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the reaction

fields.name: total_count
fields.description: Number of times the reaction was added

MessageReactionUpdated.name: MessageReactionUpdated
description: This object represents a change of a reaction on a message performed by a user.

fields.name: chat
fields.description: The chat containing the message the user reacted to

fields.name: message_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the message inside the chat

fields.name: user
fields.description: Optional. The user that changed the reaction, if the user isn't anonymous

fields.name: actor_chat
fields.description: Optional. The chat on behalf of which the reaction was changed, if the user is anonymous

fields.name: date
fields.description: Date of the change in Unix time

fields.name: old_reaction
fields.description: Previous list of reaction types that were set by the user

fields.name: new_reaction
fields.description: New list of reaction types that have been set by the user

MessageReactionCountUpdated.name: MessageReactionCountUpdated
description: This object represents reaction changes on a message with anonymous reactions.

fields.name: chat
fields.description: The chat containing the message

fields.name: message_id
fields.description: Unique message identifier inside the chat

fields.name: date
fields.description: Date of the change in Unix time

fields.name: reactions
fields.description: List of reactions that are present on the message

ForumTopic.name: ForumTopic
description: This object represents a forum topic.

fields.name: message_thread_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the forum topic

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the topic

fields.name: icon_color
fields.description: Color of the topic icon in RGB format

fields.name: icon_custom_emoji_id
fields.description: Optional. Unique identifier of the custom emoji shown as the topic icon

BotCommand.name: BotCommand
description: This object represents a bot command.

fields.name: command
fields.description: Text of the command; 1-32 characters. Can contain only lowercase English letters, digits and underscores.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description of the command; 1-256 characters.

BotCommandScope.name: BotCommandScope
description: This object represents the scope to which bot commands are applied. Currently, the following 7 scopes are supported:
- BotCommandScopeDefault
- BotCommandScopeAllPrivateChats
- BotCommandScopeAllGroupChats
- BotCommandScopeAllChatAdministrators
- BotCommandScopeChat
- BotCommandScopeChatAdministrators
- BotCommandScopeChatMember

BotCommandScopeDefault.name: BotCommandScopeDefault
description: Represents the default scope of bot commands. Default commands are used if no commands with a narrower scope are specified for the user.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Scope type, must be default

BotCommandScopeAllPrivateChats.name: BotCommandScopeAllPrivateChats
description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all private chats.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Scope type, must be all_private_chats

BotCommandScopeAllGroupChats.name: BotCommandScopeAllGroupChats
description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all group and supergroup chats.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Scope type, must be all_group_chats

BotCommandScopeAllChatAdministrators.name: BotCommandScopeAllChatAdministrators
description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all group and supergroup chat administrators.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Scope type, must be all_chat_administrators

BotCommandScopeChat.name: BotCommandScopeChat
description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering a specific chat.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Scope type, must be chat

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

BotCommandScopeChatAdministrators.name: BotCommandScopeChatAdministrators
description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all administrators of a specific group or supergroup chat.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Scope type, must be chat_administrators

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

BotCommandScopeChatMember.name: BotCommandScopeChatMember
description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering a specific member of a group or supergroup chat.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Scope type, must be chat_member

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the target user

BotName.name: BotName
description: This object represents the bot's name.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The bot's name

BotDescription.name: BotDescription
description: This object represents the bot's description.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The bot's description

BotShortDescription.name: BotShortDescription
description: This object represents the bot's short description.

fields.name: short_description
fields.description: The bot's short description

MenuButton.name: MenuButton
description: This object describes the bot's menu button in a private chat. It should be one of
- MenuButtonCommands
- MenuButtonWebApp
- MenuButtonDefault

If a menu button other than MenuButtonDefault is set for a private chat, then it is applied in the chat. Otherwise the default menu button is applied. By default, the menu button opens the list of bot commands.

MenuButtonCommands.name: MenuButtonCommands
description: Represents a menu button, which opens the bot's list of commands.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the button, must be commands

MenuButtonWebApp.name: MenuButtonWebApp
description: Represents a menu button, which launches a Web App.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the button, must be web_app

fields.name: text
fields.description: Text on the button

fields.name: web_app
fields.description: Description of the Web App that will be launched when the user presses the button. The Web App will be able to send an arbitrary message on behalf of the user using the method answerWebAppQuery. Alternatively, a t.me link to a Web App of the bot can be specified in the object instead of the Web App's URL, in which case the Web App will be opened as if the user pressed the link.

MenuButtonDefault.name: MenuButtonDefault
description: Describes that no specific value for the menu button was set.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the button, must be default

ChatBoostSource.name: ChatBoostSource
description: This object describes the source of a chat boost. It can be one of
- ChatBoostSourcePremium
- ChatBoostSourceGiftCode
- ChatBoostSourceGiveaway

ChatBoostSourcePremium.name: ChatBoostSourcePremium
description: The boost was obtained by subscribing to Telegram Premium or by gifting a Telegram Premium subscription to another user.

fields.name: source
fields.description: Source of the boost, always "premium"

fields.name: user
fields.description: User that boosted the chat

ChatBoostSourceGiftCode.name: ChatBoostSourceGiftCode
description: The boost was obtained by the creation of Telegram Premium gift codes to boost a chat. Each such code boosts the chat 4 times for the duration of the corresponding Telegram Premium subscription.

fields.name: source
fields.description: Source of the boost, always "gift_code"

fields.name: user
fields.description: User for which the gift code was created

ChatBoostSourceGiveaway.name: ChatBoostSourceGiveaway
description: The boost was obtained by the creation of a Telegram Premium or a Telegram Star giveaway. This boosts the chat 4 times for the duration of the corresponding Telegram Premium subscription for Telegram Premium giveaways and prize_star_count / 500 times for one year for Telegram Star giveaways.

fields.name: source
fields.description: Source of the boost, always "giveaway"

fields.name: giveaway_message_id
fields.description: Identifier of a message in the chat with the giveaway; the message could have been deleted already. May be 0 if the message isn't sent yet.

fields.name: user
fields.description: Optional. User that won the prize in the giveaway if any; for Telegram Premium giveaways only

fields.name: prize_star_count
fields.description: Optional. The number of Telegram Stars to be split between giveaway winners; for Telegram Star giveaways only

fields.name: is_unclaimed
fields.description: Optional. True, if the giveaway was completed, but there was no user to win the prize

ChatBoost.name: ChatBoost
description: This object contains information about a chat boost.

fields.name: boost_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the boost

fields.name: add_date
fields.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the chat was boosted

fields.name: expiration_date
fields.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the boost will automatically expire, unless the booster's Telegram Premium subscription is prolonged

fields.name: source
fields.description: Source of the added boost

ChatBoostUpdated.name: ChatBoostUpdated
description: This object represents a boost added to a chat or changed.

fields.name: chat
fields.description: Chat which was boosted

fields.name: boost
fields.description: Information about the chat boost

ChatBoostRemoved.name: ChatBoostRemoved
description: This object represents a boost removed from a chat.

fields.name: chat
fields.description: Chat which was boosted

fields.name: boost_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the boost

fields.name: remove_date
fields.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the boost was removed

fields.name: source
fields.description: Source of the removed boost

UserChatBoosts.name: UserChatBoosts
description: This object represents a list of boosts added to a chat by a user.

fields.name: boosts
fields.description: The list of boosts added to the chat by the user

BusinessConnection.name: BusinessConnection
description: Describes the connection of the bot with a business account.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the business connection

fields.name: user
fields.description: Business account user that created the business connection

fields.name: user_chat_id
fields.description: Identifier of a private chat with the user who created the business connection. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

fields.name: date
fields.description: Date the connection was established in Unix time

fields.name: can_reply
fields.description: True, if the bot can act on behalf of the business account in chats that were active in the last 24 hours

fields.name: is_enabled
fields.description: True, if the connection is active

BusinessMessagesDeleted.name: BusinessMessagesDeleted
description: This object is received when messages are deleted from a connected business account.

fields.name: business_connection_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the business connection

fields.name: chat
fields.description: Information about a chat in the business account. The bot may not have access to the chat or the corresponding user.

fields.name: message_ids
fields.description: The list of identifiers of deleted messages in the chat of the business account

ResponseParameters.name: ResponseParameters
description: Describes why a request was unsuccessful.

fields.name: migrate_to_chat_id
fields.description: Optional. The group has been migrated to a supergroup with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

fields.name: retry_after
fields.description: Optional. In case of exceeding flood control, the number of seconds left to wait before the request can be repeated

InputMedia.name: InputMedia
description: This object represents the content of a media message to be sent. It should be one of
- InputMediaAnimation
- InputMediaDocument
- InputMediaAudio
- InputMediaPhoto
- InputMediaVideo

InputMediaPhoto.name: InputMediaPhoto
description: Represents a photo to be sent.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the result, must be photo

fields.name: media
fields.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass "attach://<file_attach_name>" to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

fields.name: caption
fields.description: Optional. Caption of the photo to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

fields.name: parse_mode
fields.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the photo caption. See formatting options for more details.

fields.name: caption_entities
fields.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

fields.name: show_caption_above_media
fields.description: Optional. Pass True, if the caption must be shown above the message media

fields.name: has_spoiler
fields.description: Optional. Pass True if the photo needs to be covered with a spoiler animation

InputMediaVideo.name: InputMediaVideo
description: Represents a video to be sent.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the result, must be video

fields.name: media
fields.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass "attach://<file_attach_name>" to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

fields.name: thumbnail
fields.description: Optional. Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass "attach://<file_attach_name>" if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

fields.name: cover
fields.description: Optional. Cover for the video in the message. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass "attach://<file_attach_name>" to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

fields.name: start_timestamp
fields.description: Optional. Start timestamp for the video in the message

fields.name: caption
fields.description: Optional. Caption of the video to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

fields.name: parse_mode
fields.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the video caption. See formatting options for more details.

fields.name: caption_entities
fields.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

fields.name: show_caption_above_media
fields.description: Optional. Pass True, if the caption must be shown above the message media

fields.name: width
fields.description: Optional. Video width

fields.name: height
fields.description: Optional. Video height

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Optional. Video duration in seconds

fields.name: supports_streaming
fields.description: Optional. Pass True if the uploaded video is suitable for streaming

fields.name: has_spoiler
fields.description: Optional. Pass True if the video needs to be covered with a spoiler animation

InputMediaAnimation.name: InputMediaAnimation
description: Represents an animation file (GIF or H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video without sound) to be sent.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the result, must be animation

fields.name: media
fields.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass "attach://<file_attach_name>" to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

fields.name: thumbnail
fields.description: Optional. Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass "attach://<file_attach_name>" if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

fields.name: caption

fields.name: parse_mode

fields.name: caption_entities

fields.name: show_caption_above_media
fields.description: Optional. Pass True, if the caption must be shown above the message media

fields.name: width
fields.description: Optional. Animation width

fields.name: height
fields.description: Optional. Animation height

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Optional. Animation duration in seconds

fields.name: has_spoiler
fields.description: Optional. Pass True if the animation needs to be covered with a spoiler animation

InputMediaAudio.name: InputMediaAudio

fields.name: media
fields.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass "attach://<file_attach_name>" to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. fields.name: title

More information on Sending Files: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files

The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass "attach://<file_attach_name>" if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>.
